Though my features are held in a grin
And no cicatrice shows on my skin,
It's only a veil
On a sorrowful tale,
For some scars remain hidden within.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
They were opposites, true, she and Jacques,
But attract? No, that saying's a crock.
"We're just ships," said the lass,
"In the night. We will pass."
Slyly smiling, he countered: "Let's dock."

limerick_list.author: Reia Light and Engineer
limerick_list.text:
Clever me, got a deal on my ride!
I mean, sure, the transmission is fried,
And the tires lack air,
But the salesman said they're
Quite all right—they're just flat on one side!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I'm a palindrome!" Very astute
Was our Otto, that drunken ol' coot.
"Spell my name left or right,
You'll get Otto all night,
But when read inside out, you get Toot!"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Did our Jewishness not come across?
Whether deep-fried or smothered in sauce,
They're Crangonidae, shrimp.
We'd as soon dine on chimp.
This bar-mitzvah reception's a loss.

limerick_list.author: Nan
limerick_list.text:
The abada's a hell of a flirt.
He likes to dress up for dessert.
He's a rhinoceros;
He looks so prepoceros
In the long flowing sleeves of his shirt.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
I know, for I carried out checks
When I lived for a while with my 'ex',
That a gamete's design
Is to find and combine
With a cell of the opposite sex.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Is my amorism blessing or curse?
I'm obsessed, but a man could do worse.
Love's my only delight.
Still, I don't feel contrite;
This compulsion's sublimely diverse.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Don't fall into Microsoft's trap
When they say it's a true killer app.
It might well excel,
But the outlook ain't swell:
The word on the street is it's crap.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Would a fast-growing maple be good
As a tree in your yard?  Well, it could,
If a clear, sunny spot
Can be found, but if not,
It's a risk, with this tree's brittle wood.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Touch an object, the feelings you'll get
Will be epiperipheral, yet,
If they rise or begin
(As with hunger) within
They're an entoperipheral set.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Book of Genesis: lo and behold,
The great patriarchs' history—told
Slightly differently twice,
With variety's spice.
Inconsistency: curse of the old.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Like champagne? Sample Dom Pérignon.
When you try it, you'll cry, "C'est si bon!"
But don't drink to excess,
Or you'll wake up a mess
With much sinning for which to atone.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I've some very good wine in my flask.
Wanna taste a wee drop? So just ask!
It's an old one, you know,
A Merlot from Bordeaux:
It is bottle-aged (not in a cask).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Banzai is a word you won't see
In Milano, Berlin, or Paris.
In Japan the word cheers,
Meaning "ten thousand years,"
While a bonsai's a miniature tree.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
When it's rainy, competitive sorts
Can do battle in tabletop sports
Such as crokinole. Slide
In a disc from the side
To the centre. No need to wear shorts.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
It's the final lap now and it's clear
That to win he must speed from the rear.
So with pedal to metal,
The race he will settle:
Accelerate!  Shift to high gear!

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Roman agents kept Caesar advised
That the Teutons outside were outsized.
Thus informed, he erected
High walls that deflected
Their plans—and weren't they half surprised!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
"What is darkful has absence of light,"
As a writer quite rightly might write.
But to pen the remark,
"Light is absence of dark,"
Shows the writer's insightful and bright.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
Lovely farmhouse for sale (or for rent)
Plus some farmland (ten acres) in Kent.
I see nice wooden gables,
And there must be some stables
(I can tell by the sweet equine scent).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We were hunting and grunting in pairs,
When my partner got caught unawares
By a grizzly who spun
And then brandished a gun.
Let's abolish the right to arm bears.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"With no job, he's an awfully big spender.
Never drank, yet he's now on a bender.
At the time of the crime,
He was dressed as a mime."
"It adds up.  Let's go pinch the offender."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Are you hungry? Well I have a hunch
That you'd relish a good Chinese lunch.
I never have seen sauce
As tangy as bean sauce—
It gives Chinese cooking a punch.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Sir Calidore searched west and east,
Found and muzzled the dread blattant beast.
With its clamorous lungs,
Iron teeth, thousand tongues
Blocked with chains, blatant calumny ceased.

limerick_list.author: Evan Schiller
limerick_list.text:
For a driver to make a decision,
To avoid an impending collision
With an oncoming bus,
Depth perception's a plus.
Thank the Lord for binocular vision!

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
What are these old pants, would you say?
One leg has been cut clean away.
Said the man in the know
At the Antiques Roadshow,
"They are Long John's long johns.  Worth 10K."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Fix this photo of Moon in your mind.
She's the kid we've been ordered to find."
Some celebrity's brat
Is job one, and that's that.
To long hours of work I'm resigned.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our dining room table's extensible.
It pulls out to serve ten; that seems sensible.
But to welcome my cousin,
You invited two dozen—
Reprehensible, Ted, indefensible!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An A-team's superior, though that
Won't mean that they won't have to show that.
It's not just a name;
They're deserving of fame.
I pity the fool who don't know that!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"In the late Carboniferous era,
A coal-burning, flying chimera
Consumed all the fuel,
Like that oil-grabbing fool
Mister Bush," so reports al-Jazeera.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You're invited to visit "Auld Reekie."
Toss cabers!  Eat haggis!  Get freaky!
Up beside the North Sea,
If you ever should be
In that neighborhood, come take a peekie!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
If you're driven (it's only a hunch),
There are guys you can beat to the punch.
Your decisive first move
Gets you into a groove
As you eat competition for lunch.

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
At a cookout, you'd want a potato
With beefsteak, and also a plate o'
Delicious baked beans,
Fluffy biscuits, some greens,
And a nice juicy beefsteak tomato.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
"There is much you can learn from one's gait;
That's their manner of walking," said Kate.
"If antalgic, that means
On the good leg one leans
'Cause the painful one can't bear much weight."

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
My apologies, sir, on my word!
My courtesy flush won't be heard.
I feel like a fool,
Since I'd swallowed a jewel
And must thoroughly check every turd.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
For Italian cuisine I've a yen;
Serve me chicken cacciatore again.
Chop tomatoes, then stew
With some mushrooms, and you
Can add either a cock or a hen.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You're in Poland, and feeling the urge
For a drug that will cause a good  purge.
Though not found near the Vistula,
The tree canafistula
Yields a drug that makes feces emerge.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
Behold the most ripe avocado:	
Its nature is sometimes like Lotto.
Once its rough skin you peel,
What will it reveal?
It's the pits if the inside is rotto.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A Switzerland bank says I'll earn
All the interest with little concern
That the Feds can acquire
The date of my wire,
So soon I'll have money to Bern.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
You're a heck of a good politician;
You tell lies with no sense of contrition.
Lay your cards on the table—
Tell the truth, if you're able—
No more secrets, just facts, no omission.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Roland broke into Pam's recitation
At Sunday's free-verse celebration.
Seven "poems" she had shared
When he stood up and dared:
"Let's have rhymes and some anapestation!"

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Here's my caddie-cum-girlfriend's critique:
"Your darn golf bag was heav— Let me speak!
It's now light (fewer sticks),
Carries balls (down to six):
All the rest have been claimed by the creek."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
I spent days sculpting baskets with pride
To adorn your new building's front side.
Now you say I'm to blame
Since it seems that your aim
Was my corbeils should harm someone's hide?

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Commutators and brushes? Passe.
Electronic control is the way
To make magnets in motors
Spin up (they're called rotors):
Performance way more than okay.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The drug acebutolol treats
Hypertension, irregular beats
Of the heart, and angina.
My North Carolina
Physician is touting its feats.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Thomas Mann, in his novel, was countin'
On his character, Hans, as a fountain
Of meaningful queries
On life and its theories
While he lived on the magical mountain.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I've been trying to open a cask,
But it's proving a difficult task.
So I'll bang on it hard,
Bung it up in the yard,
Rip the bung out, and fill up my flask.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The birder's existence is rife
With adventure and danger and strife.
In heat like a sauna
I watched avifauna
While bird-watchers ogled my wife.

limerick_list.author: Mr. Davis
limerick_list.text:
En route to a fine cabaret,
Looking smart in your scarf and beret,
On Broadway you'll find,
As you're losing your mind,
Life is naught but a big cab array.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Triple bypass-graft patient Jack Sprat 'n'
His wife couldn't tolerate statin.
Cooking HeartHealth cuisine,
Found she couldn't stand 'lean' —
She snuck lard from her larder, stuck fat in.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A black widow spider named Hedley,
With her hourglass tat glowing redly,
Took her hubby to bed
On the night they were wed—
But the sex was so dull, it was deadly.

limerick_list.author: Amelia A
limerick_list.text:
A Cesarian section combines
A live birth with a slice along lines
Cut from navel to mound,
Or across the raised round
Of a belly, where baby reclines.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
These are catclaws: the prickly plants
That are often the cause of my rants.
Like the claws of a feline,
Their thorns make a beeline
For mischief. They stick to my pants.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
A rampant asexual called Ricky
Said, "Surely you don't want a hickey?
I'll give a chaste kiss;
But much further than this
Makes me sick — it's so icky, and sticky."

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
Well, an angel appeared to this girl
And he said, "You should sit, you might hurl.
Give a smile, don't be glum,
'Cause you're set to become
Mom to Jesus! Just give it a whirl!"

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Our high school production of Hair
Was stopped on account of Aunt Clare.
She yelled, "Blasphemy! Blasphemy!
That's way too much ass fuh me!"
And the cast found it too much to bear.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When it's Nisan, a month in the spring,
Some Israelis will plan for a fling
And a break from the job
In the summer—say, Ab—
At a lake with a hammock and swing.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When the College of Cardinals shared
Who they'd made the new pope, they declared,
"There is nary a smirch
On his work for the Church,
So this Pontiff is holy prepared."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
What a pterrible pthing it would be:
I'd look up at pthe branch of a ptree,
Where arrayed by pthe dozens,
Pterodacytlish cousins
Hunt poor archaeopteryx—me.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If you're known as a criminal guy
To 'the Feds' — say, a fraudster or spy —
They'll be soon on your tail,
Track you down without fail.
That's the job of the States' FBI.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
A swimmer embarked on a quest
To discover which stroke she liked best,
So her coach, with his hands
Stroking muscles and glands,
Showed the stroke she liked best was the breast.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The botany's open and shut
On the green avocado. Yes, but
If you look at the tree
Where it hangs, you will see
Not a berry or fruit, but a nut.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Most companies feel more robust
When part of a corporate trust
And when acting like brothers:
Resistance to others
Grows stronger. Some think it a must.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's his birthday; I'll put out a feeler.
What would Pete like? He visits a dealer
Of large and small trucks.
I don't have lots of bucks—
Hope he falls for a modest four-wheeler.

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
Our airplane's last engine is stalling.
From the sky, we are rapidly falling!
Yet, the look on your face
Is of bliss, peace, and grace...
You've a calmness I find quite appalling!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The fashion to pat, press and primp
Waves in hair, in a style called a crimp,
Flatters no-one; it's clear
A crimped girl looks severe—
While a man with a crimp looks a wimp!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Beelzebub, Devil, Old Nick,
Old Scratch, perhaps Satan: your pick.
But when Bush was about
Many folks had no doubt
That his Faustian pact was with Dick.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Doktor Freud caused indignant, loud screams,
When he set up dream symbols and schemes
To interpret the id,
Where we secretly hid
What cigars might (uhm) stand for in dreams.

limerick_list.author: bestswanbird
limerick_list.text:
I'm ahoight 'cos you tell me you care.
Feeling great, I am walking on air.
On my face is a smirk,
And I hum while I work—
I'm just loving this secret affair.

limerick_list.author: Bob Colonna
limerick_list.text:
It's the one hundredth birthday, you know,
Of the playwright who gave us Godot,
(Whose advent's a no-go
For Didi and Gogo),
So, Samuel Beckett, good show!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Not a beast fit for pulling a wagon,
The fearsome and fire-breathing dragon,
Both morbid and gory,
Lives only in story,
So quit your preposterous braggin'.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
When he flew to Peru, Captain Pugh
Played his didgeridoo in the loo,
Till the crew had a fit,
Begging, "Pugh, will you quit
With that ludicrous bit of bamboo!"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
No, you can't have this dance — I'm bespoken.
There's no beau here whose heart I've not broken.
But after the dance
On the subway I'll chance
Going home with you, by the same token.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
So you think you're some master detective?
Your findings are clearly defective!
Before you accuse,
Walk a mile in my shoes.
It'll give you a different perspective.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Curval,  curvant and  curvate, I've heard,
Are three words which mean "curved". How absurd!
I've been wracking my brain,
But I cannot explain
How this lexical excess occurred.

limerick_list.author: Julia
limerick_list.text:
For male Jewish babies, a bris
Is a time to remove some of this
Unsanctified foreskin.
Some wish they had more skin,
But it shouldn't affect how they piss.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
I said, "'Yellowish alloy of copper
And zinc' is distinctly a proper
Description of brass,"
In my lame, brazen pass
At the radiant light fixture shopper.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The young moyel took time to explain;
Snipping foreskins caused infants no pain.
Then while some blocked their vision,
He performed circumcision.
"Hey folks, can I get an Amen?"

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Dis Pater had made up his mind:
Proserpina and I'd stay behind.
I was cold and effacing;
While she was embracing
Dispassionately, then, I declined.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Colonoscopy: tube up my butt
To examine the health of my gut.
This procedure will answer
"Got polyps or cancer?"
They'll poke around, pinch off and cut.

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
Teenage acne left scars on Louise,
Who popped pimples throughout her disease.
At her boyfriend's persuasion,
She tried dermabrasion.
The surgeon is now her main squeeze.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Elmer's cheating and breaking his vow,
So they're having this terrible row:
Elsie's sure that he strayed,
"Cut the bull—you got laid!"
He's been thinking of pleading "mad cow".

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cinderella had gone to the ball
Though at midnight, I'm sure you recall,
The spell was complete,
But because of her feet
She wound up with the Prince after all.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With my hearing aids quickly I fumble
As she says, "(mumble, mumble) I'm (mumble)."
Although I'm not to blame,
"I did not get your name,"
I reply. "Please speak up, dear," I grumble.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
With a sapphire of staggering size
I came home, and it dazzled her eyes.
She was thrilled and amazed
'Til she had it appraised...
Now I'm broke and alone, but more wise.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Long ago, when New England was new,
And a man sought a damsel to woo,
He would call her his dowsabel.
What?  No, not how's a belle
Drenchable!  Sweetheart, that's who!

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
"This bannister's not cable-laid!"
Did the boatswain his deckhand upbraid.
"It's with sinister twists,
Of yer dexterous wrists,
That yon' handrail should be macraméd!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The textbooks can't seem to agree
Why they call it the cry-baby tree.
It is not like a willow
That cries in its pillow.
It's brave—as a tree ought to be.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
For this ego that I have been dealt,
Please don't gift me with necktie or belt.
But a new derby hat
Would be great; give me that,
'Cause I crave that my presents be felt.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
The brunette, to look more like a belle,
Thought that ash blonde would work very well.
But she did something rash:
Mixed peroxide with ash.
Now the color is ugly as hell.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Stop them sucking your blood? It's no dice:
They hang on for dear life, body lice.
They're nasty, these cooties,
For certain no beauties.
They make you feel lousy — not nice!

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
I can see my electric device
Could well shock me for lack of a splice
(It's beginning to fray).
"What absorbs shocks?" you say?
Electricians who aren't so precise.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Every Blume isn't certain to be
Productive, attractive (like me),
Since we also have felons
With heads shaped like melons:
A branch of our family tree.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
As Braemar's horticultural champion,
I've hybridized red and white campion
With catchfly, their kin.
My pinks are so 'in',
I'm the number 1 grower in Grampian.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
From his last one he lights his next fag,
Gets a fix of his drug with each drag.
"Where's my wealth?" he will joke.
"Up in smoke! I am broke."
As he chain-smokes, he coughs up each gag.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
To a mixture of salt, fat, and flour,
Add a cup of cold milk, beat an hour
With the flat of an axe;
Form as spheres, place on racks,
Prick three times with a fork, bake, devour.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In a Bronco the fugitive fled,
O. J. Simpson, a killer, some said.
Johnny Cochran defended
The man apprehended.
Now he's having lunch at Club Med.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
"By renouncing the Church," said the pope,
"All those priests walked a slippery slope.
But they've voiced their regret;
Let's forgive and forget."
Said the Donatist rigorists, "Nope!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"She's got breathiness," said the director;
He was ready just then to select her.
"She has breathlessness?" Mel
Didn't hear very well
And demanded the boss man reject her.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Our vicar's wife brought relief speedily
To those who were living too needily:
While he wordily prayed
To the heavens for aid,
She came to their help — and right deedily.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Dear Mr or Mrs or Sir,
I implore you to make quite a stir
Re: the cat food I've packed,
As I think it's a fact
That the samples will make your pet purr.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
A cartridge fuse lets any rube
Fix a fault without making a boob.
No need to perspire
Using pliers and wire,
You just clip in this fuse-in-a-tube.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Some young New Year's Eve celebrators
Drank champagne on ice. (They were skaters.)
Said one, "I've jushjt thunk
Thashjt we shjouldn't get jdrunk."
Then he held out his glass to the waiters.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"There's a bumblebee spy," said the flea,
"Watching bugs by the Caspian Sea.
He's so secretive (very!)
And cautiously wary,
He goes by the name 'Cagey Bee'!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Code Amber!" The staff is alarmed
Since this means that a robbery (armed)
Is in progress, or maybe
Some jerk's grabbed a baby.
Just pray that it's brought back unharmed.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Your father stood firm for the deed
When it came to supplying the seed;
One has grown to be you
(With mum's egg helping too).
Life's great miracle comes when we breed.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
When, at sunset, the day starts to wane,
All the daytimer stations abstain
From sending their wattage
To my little cottage
Since the FCC says to refrain.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Bartholomew Cubbins, it's said,
Would wear five hundred hats on his head.
Every night, before sleep,
He would hang up the heap,
And his hatrack would tremble with dread.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Like a sail on a mizzen-mast's yard,
This banner for battle has starred
In heraldic expressions
And holy processions;
The gonfalon's story dies hard.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
This new diet's a drag: I'm to eat
Nothing rich, nothing fatty or sweet.
What says Hilary Briss?
"Take a butcher's at this:
Feast your eyes on a spread of red meat."

limerick_list.author: SafetyDog
limerick_list.text:
"Invest in a 401(k).
Now's the time and you mustn't delay!"
So bellowed my broker,
A white-collared joker
Who whittled my nickels away.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The OEDILF's a phenomenal thing,
Though we only began this past spring.
But anticipate where
We'll end up?  Not a prayer!
Who knows what the future may bring?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Every time that I walk past the school
I attended (attired like a fool),
I recall the short skirt
That I wore as a flirt—
Looking hot as I tried to look cool.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm the buckthorn, a nettlesome tree,
And diversity isn't for me.
I put maples through hell
(Kick some aspen, as well).
Where I grow, oaks and underbrush flee.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"We need flowers," said the soon-to-be groom,
"A small spray — on the day of my doom —
For the breast of each guest.
But what buttonhole's best?
They'll take budding; my bride, she'll abloom."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My confirmator's here. He will try
To validate facts. He's the guy
Who confirms or rejects
What folks say, and detects
If they're truthful or telling or a lie.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Take a bent piece of bone, with a cord
Attached to both ends (which are scored).
The cord's made to curl
Round a shaft it will twirl —
With this bow drill a hole can be bored.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
If your aim's to expose or disclose
Something secret or cloaked, I suppose
You could show it or tell it,
Be novel and spell it
In limerick form or in prose.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The field geoscience is where
Dan and Dotty began their affair.
With each other? Oh, no.
Out to diggings they go.
It's a love of the Earth that they share.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
A cherry is really a plum
(Lat. Prunus cerasus, my chum).
But it's round, and it's red,
And my grandmother said
She preferred it in jam or with rum.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A black widow (the femme, not the spider)
Is found in whodunits worldwide. Her
Intent is to wed
And then to leave, dead,
Each husband she's picked as provider.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Rhetorical rants against Bush
Come from some with agendas to push.
"I don't follow, professor.
Why's Bush the aggressor?
'Cause he's kicking some terrorist tush?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a strip that's been known to enrage
Every right-wing conservative sage.
It's called Doonesbury and
Even foes understand
Of its type, it's the top of this age.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Chemosterilants don't affect mating,
But they do keep the nursery waiting—
Not just for a while,
But Miss Havisham style.
Are they safe? Well, that's up for debating.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I've an entryway two stories high
With an atrium lit by the sky.
It's there I raise orchids
And bring up my four kids.
That courtyard's my place till I die.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
This we heard just today from our teacher:
"The Aquarium's starting to feature
Its argonaut. She's
A rare octopus; please
Get permission to see this strange creature."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Once you foolishly gave me your all;
Once you fatuously lived in my thrall.
I've wised up: I was dumb.
So just whistle; I'll come.
Call me Bogey; I'll call you Bacall.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
The preposterous mollusk between us
Is a geoduck, part of the genus
Panopea. Hot damn,
It's an odd sort of clam,
'Cause it looks a lot more like a penis!

limerick_list.author: Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
Assai's not a breath of lament,
Nor a country I'd have to invent.
It's a musical phrase,
So you knows when you plays
To do more—it means "very", I meant.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
That party was fun, a real blast!
Let's now get us ensobered, real fast.
What's my un-drunk routine?
A big shot of caffeine,
Plus McDonald's cuisine — unsurpassed!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Something's freezable? Then we can freeze it.
If it's squeezable, go on and squeeze it.
If you do it, it's doable,
But the rule's not renewable—
If it's feasible, how can we fease it?

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
To blush: to get red in the face
From the modesty, shame, or disgrace
You would feel being viewed
When you're drunk and/or nude
(Or some other embarrassing case).

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You can speak without getting attacked;
You can criticize, argue, detract.
You can draw a cartoon,
You can mock and lampoon.
Thank God freedom of speech is a fact.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Your vocation?" was asked of the bloke,
And he didn't reply as a joke.
Then his offhand remarks
Brought arrest by the narcs—
"I am known in this town as King Coak!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What's the beam of a ship? It's how wide
Such a vessel is spread side to side.
If your boat has a beam
That is big, it would seem
With great cargo space you've been supplied.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A conservative newsstand, it's clear,
Grows more zealously right-wing each year.
When I asked if they'd read
Humpty Dumpty, they said,
"We don't carry pornography here!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
In the name of the Marquis de Sade,
I've assembled a noble escouade.
(From the French, that means "squad".)
We may strike you as odd.
We may strike you, in fact, very hard.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
As the school board prepared to cast votes
To adopt some new textbooks, some notes
From the Chair to the floor
Read: "You will please ignore
All these salesmen with knives at our throats!"

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
The show Knight Rider featured a car
That's intelligent (more than the star).
Once inert, now alive
(And man, can it drive!).
Autogenesis took them quite far.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
As the scattering splinters fell flat,
Thought the ump, "I am smelling a rat."
Upon finding some cork,
He ejected the dork.
His one clue was that flung fractured bat.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
I'm not pleased when a limerick is lewd;
They are often obscene—very crude.
But an innocent rhyme
I enjoy every time.
I admit I'm an old-fashioned prude.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Rows of numbers have formed an array
On Kay's laptop—a digital display.
"Prices, types of supplies
That I need to bake pies
Lie in front of my eyes!" exclaims Kay.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
We are mouse-like, Acomys. Hello!
Try to catch us? We go with the flow:
From the tail to the head
We deglove, or we shed —
And the next thing you know, we regrow.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The All England Law Reports bases
Its published reports on court cases.
These form the resource
To which all have recourse
And which precedent judgment embraces.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A cossid rode up to a pub
In Bombay, bringing news of a grub—
So delicious a treat
Many Aussies would eat
Cossid stew and give sirloin the snub.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
"I opened a lemonade stand",
As a resumé phrase, isn't grand.
If you've nothing to vouch
For your skills, you might couch
This as "filling niche markets' demand".

limerick_list.author: oneslowtyper
limerick_list.text:
A bunter's a batter who bunts—
Fools the infield with all of his stunts.
He will place the ball well,
Turn for first—run like hell.
And the catcher just sits like a dunce.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Evening stroll to the dock? Thank you, not.
Those mosquito hordes get me distraught.
There's no way to fight back
When those swarmers attack;
It's too dark to effectively swat.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Though my dog is by no means a bad one,
My story with him is a sad one.
He gives me affection
But not much protection;
I shouted, "Attack!"...and he had one.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Twin Sisters named Dolly were known
For their dancing and acting, and prone
To the high life. Folks heard
The new term dolly bird,
Which was coined for the looks made their own.

limerick_list.author: Kuranui
limerick_list.text:
A low shrub, by the name of beach heather,
Thrives high on the dunes in all weather.
In northeast USA,
It's like heath on the bay,
With its tiny white blooms tight together.

limerick_list.author: Wordmatic
limerick_list.text:
A capon's a rooster whose loss
Makes him more a fine meal than a boss;
Though deprived of the joy
He might know as a boy,
Once roasted, he's heaven in sauce.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Relief was the hope of a man
Who, while using the can in Iran,
Found he'd emptied his bowels
Clear up to his jowls
And fell in, though that wasn't his plan.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Right in Paris, not part of a chain,
Is an ancient hotel on the Seine.
The good desk clerk may let
Nineteen rooms. All guests get
Antique quarters and nothing mundane.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
My wife loves me no whit the less
Wearing skirts (I mean me!): I cross-dress.
She gives me permission
To strut, on condition
She still wears the trousers. Oh yes!

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
Kim Jong at the zoo: "I demand a
New bear cub for state propaganda.
If mating of Ping Ping
With Long Dong goes 'ding ding',
Then four-month gestation: new panda."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A biotope: natural niche
Where the sea-plants consort with the fyshe,
Like (in Darwin's old files)
The Galapagos isles,
Or the suburbs where dwell nouveau riche.

limerick_list.author: Dick C. Erd
limerick_list.text:
When Rosemary, Ginger, and Basil
Asked Herb for his honest appraisal,
He said, "With some thyme
And some seasoning, I'm
Convinced you will sound much less nasal."

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
It is called a black book (not in praise),
Which with malice lists names so to raise
The ill favor of some,
And those files thus become
Shabby records of rancorous ways.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
When a cute sweet potato (a tuber),
Betrothed to a peanut (a goober),
Found her two-timing beau
Shagging Ida (a ho),
She declared their engagement was uber.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
An improbable beauty the cactus,
Without much in its shape to attract us.
We reached for its flowers
Then spent two more hours
Removing the spines that attacked us.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We were earnest, at least grant us that:
We'd move mountains to skin that fool cat.
But, with billions to spend,
What's emerged in the end?
All our labors have brought forth a rat.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I, today, learned what "out in the cold" meant
When you gave me no hug, no enfoldment.
That lack of embrace
Signaled I'd lost my place
And how little our circles of gold meant.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Lawd Jesus'd set down his dawtah
Whenevah he walked on da wawtah.
Y'all see how I'm li'ble
Ta 'splain ya da Bible
Exegetist-like, jes' how we awtah.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Calm leviathans gracefully sweep,
E'er exploring the floor of the deep.
They pursue things bathysmal
In dreadful and dismal
Cold canyons abysmal and steep.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In close quarters, like in an OR,
You'd think gas passers maybe would jar.
You'd be wrong. He or she
Fills a need to a T.
One in every OR's about par.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
A grammar's a book of strict rules
That are taught us in all of our schools.
Its syntax, morphology,
Semantics, phonology
Please experts and weary the fools.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I'm treating an ulcer that's tropical,
Smearing on ointment that's topical.
That stye in my eye
Is an aegilops <sigh>
(Adjectivally, that's egilopical.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Carve your fowl? Pain's forever postponed
If you buy Christmas turkeys deboned.
You won't do something dumb,
Like draw blood from your thumb,
And it's perfectly safe if you're stoned.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
Tobias, a builder from Kobe,
Built houses of glass and adobe.
As a pro he was slow.
"How was I s'pposed to know
How they'd go below snow?" bemoaned Toby.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I was knighted. Her majesty froze.
I thought: "Something unspeakable shows!"
Though my fly was zipped tight,
I, a newly dubbed knight,
Had some snot hanging out of my nose.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
An infection's attacking your ear;
Round your piercings some pus will appear.
Said my wife, "How'd you know
Suppuration will grow?"
"I consulted an auricle, dear."

limerick_list.author: Lostock Hall
limerick_list.text:
The alchemists claimed to have struck
On a way to make gold out of muck.
They called it transmuting,
But I call it shooting
A line that would not fool a duck.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I post limericks written in loads;
Never tried any sonnets or odes.
Should I choose to pursue it,
I know I can do it —
Diversify, try other modes.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
There are sounds that are clear and distinct,
Like the twang of a banjo when plinked,
Or the snap of a stalk,
Or the pop of a cork,
Or the chinking of crystal that's clinked.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Common shoppers assume they're debris:
Scrip or coin-like, some once came for free.
"Little billboards," they're named
(I've my finest ones framed).
Exonumia fascinate me.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An Australian, Les Colley, we're told,
Set a record (that I'll never hold)
With a child that he had. He
Became a new daddy
At 93 freakin' years old!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Mostly all of my friends, say reports,
Think I'm most of the time out of sorts.
But the briefs that I wear
Have initials I bear —
BVD — what they call me for shorts.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The corpse flower's quite a rare plant;
It's huge, and it stinks—that I grant.
Its phallic appearance
And need for tall clearance
Lure tourists who smell it and rant.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Our ID of this rock is conclusive:
It is dark, finely grained, and extrusive,
And it wouldn't be true
From Cape Horn to Peru
To say andesite rock is elusive.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The use of goodbye remains strong,
Though good-bye and good bye are not wrong.
There's good-by and good by
That you're welcome to try.
You can't make up your mind? Use so long!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
In London, well-known for its fogs,
An inventor screwed sprockets and cogs.
Exclaimed Babbage, "I've done it!
Here's data—now run it!
An engine to calculate logs!"

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Cefadroxil: bacteria killer;
Ceftazidime: should you get iller.
Cefoperazone, too,
Is a germ-killing brew.
These are cephalosporins, not filler.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Poor young Tom failed the prison guard test.
He's dejected and really depressed.
"Coulda been a contender,
But went on a bender.
I'm in jail, not a guard but a guest."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I exploded a bombshell today:
I revealed to my mother I'm gay.
She exploded one back:
"Son, I've got to go pack.
I'm a rookie tight end for Green Bay."

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Disembodied, I walk through the wall
And I float through the air; I can't fall.
My discorporate form
Is becoming the norm,
And I hardly feel dead now at all.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Silly Sidney won't listen to me.
He's tone deaf — drives me out of my tree.
I will lose all my cool
And yell, "Sid, you big fool!
Now look sharp! Don't see flat! Let it be!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My two lips, and my back, and my chin,
And my neck, and my butt, and each shin
Are all covered with this,
What you touch when you kiss.
Dermatography? Treatise on skin.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Get a corkscrew—a curly device
That will lift out your corks in a trice.
Never stab at the cork
With the prongs of a fork;
Oh, you may do it once, but not twice.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
How'd the Alamo come to be known?
'Twas a mission in ol' San Antone.
On a line in the sand,
Volunteers took a stand,
When their orders said "Leave it alone."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"All that clatter and din. What a racket!
And the cost: giant taxpayer packet!"
"This great 'Coathanger', Maud,
Spans our Harbour, so broad."
"Just imagine the size of the jacket!"

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
The warden stands guard from his perch.
His goal:  to keep peace in the church.
He edituates so
That the scoundrels go "Whoa!
This temple we'd best not besmirch!"

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Why's that sign keep a-blinkin'  at me?
That one, just up ahead?  Oh, I see—
It is tellin' me, "Halt!"
No—it's just Uncle Walt
Advertisin'  his "Specials 4T."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
They jammed me right next to a loser (large).
On my next long-haul flight I will choose a large
Seat for my ass
With champagne in first class,
And a legroomy wide-bodied fuselage.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My poor pooch—all her pups were born dead.
"Poor nutrition," I think the vet said.
Guess their half-starved prenatalness
Proved a sad  fatalness.
For months my dog only ate bread.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
If you're tossing a coin in the air,
Irrespective of whether it's fair,
For each ratio thrown,
Probability's known,
And predictably common or rare.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As a writer, Jannine's unattractive
 Because for long spells she's inactive.
 I suspect her work's shallowness
 Is caused by this fallowness;
 I wish she were more interactive.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This enzyme performs at its best
At acidic pHs, it's stressed
By a source found online
That I'll use to define
Acid hydrolase at your request.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
This Indian deer likes to chomp
In the grassy wet bed of the swamp.
It's got antlers galore—
Say, a dozen or more!
Barasingha's not lacking in pomp.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
You say Burma changed names, well ha ha.
Just you wait 'til I tell my ol' Pa.
Will we now have to crave
A new Myanmar shave?
Think we'll stick with the old, me 'n' Ma.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Here's a summary (only a stub):
Hamlet, dreaming, walked into a pub.
But the bartender said,
"You can't drink here — you're dead."
Denmark's Prince exclaimed, "Ay, there's the rub."

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
An awning of canvas gives shade
Over windows and doorways of trade.
This strong cotton canopy
Shelters a panoply
Of wares being proudly displayed.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Disembark, find my flight's carousel.
Watch the bags ride around. They look swell!
But where's my portmanteau?
Packed up in this canto,
It's "bagonise" (lost luggage hell).

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Jersey yellow, or fat-reduced white,
At the top of the milk, day and night,
In my lactose-filled dream,
As I sup on the cream,
I take more of a slurp than a bite.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
When a male and a female gamete
Reproductively meet on the street,
They commence amphimixis:
A bond which transfixes
Components of kids—head to feet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Among comics, this lady's a pillar;
And of homemaker's lives a distiller.
Her admirers would hang
On the foibles of Fang—
That's the husband of whom? Phyllis Diller.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When the ne'er-do-well idler—a bencher—
Stole the meat she had placed on the trencher,
Pam was mad as a hatter.
"The steak on that platter
Should shatter—God willing—his denture!"

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
When you're driving along on the straight
And the lorry you pass has a plate
With the letters GB,
Call out, "God save the Queeeeeee..."
'Cos its driver thinks Britain is great.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All secular pleasures she'll shun:
The cenobite—she is the one
Who's contented to care
For the needy, with prayer,
As she's living the life of a nun.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
According to Cocker there's just
One way to add up. It's a must
To read his book first,
And then you will thirst
For addition, no longer nonplussed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She was star of the play (summer stock),
And the prettiest girl on the block.
When she said, "See you soon,"
I fell down in a swoon;
Wish my love life had been anti-shock.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Made with chitlins (from hogs) or with tripe,
Oddly named in a hybrid-type hype
Is the andouillette sausage,
A linguistical crossage.
For purists, it's reason to gripe.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A fever dream, that's what I had —
One confusing, intense, really bad.
Joe Biden? Rejected!
Damn! Trump's reelected —
With his Russian VP, namely Vlad.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Supposin' you've frozen your toes
When you goes in the snows without clothes?
My intent's not to censure
Your sense of adventure.
But brain damage—plainly it shows.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
My kitten is fond of affriction.
It's not, for a cat, an affliction.
If I don't stroke his head,
He will pet me instead.
He's a kitty with scritchin' addiction.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's a claypan, a hole, that I spy:
A depression that's shallow and dry.
But it soon will be filling
With rain—overspilling.
(A thundercloud's up in the sky.)

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Apologetics: a subject that's core
For Catholic scholars no more.
A pity, I'd say,
For surely (oy vey!)
They have much to apologize for!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I've plans, I admit with a groan,
I am clean out of funds of my own.
If I build this tract soon,
I will be a tycoon,
So I'll ask for an ADC loan.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With my grandsons, I'll often invite 'em
To pick out some toys to delight 'em,
But my Andrew has got
His heart set on a yacht!
Sorry, kid.  That's a big-ticket item.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
They say that an apple a day
Will keep that ol' doctor away.
There's a hairier task
It can't do (so don't ask),
Which is holding the devil at bay.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Used in all sorts of guns, big and small,
There's a cartridge the armies call "ball."
But the name must be wrong
Since it's narrow and long
And the bullet's not ball-shaped at all.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A series of payments to come
Has been capitalized by my chum—
An accountant who knows
How the formula goes
For computing a capital sum.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"This hotel room is huge, but germs spoil it.
I won't sleep in that bed till you boil it!"
"Though our hygiene's a mess,
We're commodious!" "Yes,
I agree that this place is a toilet."

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
When OEDILFers arrange that they'll meet
In a café, soon after they greet,
They'll get into the loop,
Order alphabet soup,
And make limericks from letters they eat!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In the army they'd call him a buck—
That's a private, you know—and with luck,
A promotion will come
To first class, and this dumb
Airman basic's a high muck-a-muck.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our treasured apothecary chest
Shows its age—deeply stained and distressed.
In a score of wee drawers,
Once a chemist kept stores
And devices…and one furry guest.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
Miles was midwife on Birth of the Cool,
Taking time out from bebop's 'old' school.
From the west coast they came
And they gave it the name
Of cool jazz, and this album's a jewel!

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
"Will he chase other dogs in the park?
Will a knock at the door make him bark?
Will he sit? Will he stay?
Will he always obey?
Do you mind that I ask?" questioned Mark.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A new visage was fixed to my head.
They unveiled it; I trembled with dread,
And I bellowed in terror.
They'd grafted, in error,
Not a face but a fanny instead.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
His Tierleben (Animals' Life)
Taught the world about animals' strife
And their habits as such,
In six volumes. (That much!)
Alfred Brehm's grasp of creatures was rife.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Like the Greeks, first read forwards and then
nehw ,dne eht litnu sdrawkcab ot hctiwS
You'll have learned how to read
deeps avulleh eno tA
And to alternate lines that you pen.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
I caught Vi with that big hunky Sly,
Pulled my piece, then Vi, starting to cry,
Sobbed, "Sly's love is platonic."
Though her cheating was chronic,
I, the fall guy, just swallowed Vi's lie.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Chalcogenides make up the class
(Which includes sulfide ores that make brass)
Of most compounds with S
And with Se (oh, yes,
And with Te). They make amber glass.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Some mushrooms that really can feed us
Belong to the genus Boletus.
It's a wonderful treat
If your actual bolete
Doesn't come from the species that cheat us.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
All good writers will use their own voices;
The tempo is one of their choices.
So, for better or worse,
They're controlling the verse—
It's a freedom they share—art rejoices!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
He's a cereal killer, they say—
That dread villain they call "Special K."
He scrunched Cap'n Crunch
As he sat down to brunch
At a family breakfast buffet.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
It was there that the young couple sought
Out a place for a child to be brought
Into this world of sadness
To bring peace and gladness.
In Bethlehem wonders were wrought.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
In America, when you take part in
A blood drive, recall Clara Barton.
She was founder and boss
Of the US Red Cross
(One of several such groups she'd been startin').

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Your new boyfriend's been charged with some crimes
But they're basically nickel-and-dimes.
Seems the thing he does best
Is resisting arrest.
He's been featured on Cops fifteen times.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
"Don't look at red wine," is the stark
Admonition of God, which I mark.
In the full light of day
I just drink chardonnay,
Leaving crimson shiraz till it's dark.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Two columns were joined by a curtain wall
On the campus; it served as a flirtin' wall.
Its side had a rural
Arcadian mural,
So lovers would meet at this certain wall.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Hurt like hell when I stepped on that pin!
(On the sole of my foot skin is thin).
Pain was excru-(ooh-ow)-
ciating — and how!
Now it throbs, does that hole in my skin.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
The coconut (really, I swear)
Is a mammal, like camel or bear.
Ah, but how could that be
When it grows on a tree?
It's because it gives milk and has hair.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
"My performance has never once missed.
It will bring down the house," I insist.
But the agent's not sold.
His demeanor is cold.
I'm amazed that the guy can resist!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
For the potter, a long rope of clay
Is basic, not simply for play.
She builds this coil up,
Shapes a vase, pot or cup
That's then textured and fired for display.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'm a poet. Don't chuckle and chortle,
But my goal ere I pass through death's portal,
Is to write lines that last
Using rhymes unsurpassed:
Eternization, words rendered immortal.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Any foe I am glad to anoint
With my anger by signs that are joint.
Just one finger won't do.
For my sign, I need two:
Their consignification's the point.

limerick_list.author: Wattlebird
limerick_list.text:
From the front,  the low house looked too small,
But a backsplit design allowed sprawl.
As I entered the door,
I could see there was more—
Staggered levels, with room for a hall.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
In days of old, alchemists sought
A catholicon, thinking there ought
To be some panacea.
This "cure-all" idea
For ills and disease went for nought.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The bird books will give me a spec
For the shoulders (the base of the neck).
Those short feathers, on fowl
Like a duck or an owl,
Are the cape, if you get down and check.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Here's a grand corbel arch that we made
When your dad was a mason by trade.
See, up over our heads,
Like paired upside-down treads
On small stairs? Ah, the courses we laid.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For Bolivia, Colombia, Peru,
The Andean Pact's quite a coup.
It's a free market plan
For those three countries and
Venezuela and Ecuador, too.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Said Ben Franklin, with typical candor,
About being a traitorous bander,
"No matter the weather,
We must hang together,
Or separately do so, commander."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To make your investments succeed,
Disinterest is fatal.  Indeed,
To avoid it like polio,
An active portfolio
Strategy's just what you need.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
It's anaphoretic; its minus
Seeks anodes without any shyness.
Any positive pole
Is its goal, on the whole,
Which it seeks in the absence of dryness.

limerick_list.author: geniuswaitress
limerick_list.text:
A doctor once found a new way
To tout his religion all day:
He told all his clients,
"Believe Christian Science.
The Rx is simple — just pray!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He believed wearing armor was crass,
Like that backplate of steel or of brass,
But he had to admit,
If he ever were hit,
It might save his exquisite cuirass.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Annapolis: Found in MD,
Where the Navy trains kids for the sea.
But a sailor on break
Said I'd made a mistake —
Annapolis grown on a tree.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Boil the poppy heads well, and then strain;
Add the sugar—Voilà!  No more pain.
Diacodium might
Ease arthritis all right,
But what's gained if it blights the old brain?

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
One eve, while in Eden alone,
Adam queried of God on His throne,
"You see this adjunction?
Just what is its function?"
Said God, "Let me have a rib bone."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The factory simply called "B"
Makes very expensive debris.
With positrons gnashing
Electrons, it's smashing
Out mesons with 6 GeV.

limerick_list.author: LoudNotes
limerick_list.text:
"My God said so," she claimed in debate,
And her thinking was really first-rate:
Belief is the particle
Forming an article
Of faith that thou shalt not negate.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I wonder why Arnold was snarling
When he said, "Nice lamb coat you've got, darling."
What, you think he said "dearling"
When he looked at my shearling?
It appears that to him I'm a warling.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Extempore speech is unplanned,
Unprepared, unrehearsed and offhand—
A species of blurtin'
Of which I am certain
Supply is exceeding demand.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Every paleontologist knows
That the temperature suddenly rose
In the Aptian time—
The iguanodons' prime
And the sauropods' vanishing throes.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Diane was a meteorologist
While Fred was a meaty urologist.
Now you'd like to know weather
These lives flowed together;
Urine luck!  I'm their current psychologist.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Beatle Betty" was known as a bimbo
And, frankly, as somewhat a dimbo,
But her holiday spirit
Is strong. You can hear it
Each time that she says "Merry Crimbo!"

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Your attention span's short, and what's worse,
You're attracted to writing in verse.
I suppose, if you like, you
Could focus on haiku
And limericks; both are quite terse.

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
The town's new plastic surgeon's a cad!
His behavior is ever so bad!
He feels, and he brags,
He can fix all that sags,
And he's raised a few eyebrows a tad.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
"TVs down," said my wife. I impressed her,
When I broke out my new cable tester.
Reception's now fine,
And we're both sipping wine
Watching shows 'bout an Addams named Fester.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
When a gas leak occurs in your room,
Suffocation may make it your tomb.
Seeping natural gas
Also burns, which, alas,
Often ends people's lives with a BOOM!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Do I shuffle and frown? Au contraire!
I'm as footloose as Freddy Astaire.
I could aerobate, and
(If you don't understand)
I'm referring to walking on air.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Sudden fungi, erumpent today,
Broke the soil in their sylvan display
On the moist forest floor,
Where they weren't before.
Catch the show; they'll enjoy a brief stay.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
In appearance, we try to impress:
First impressions may lead to success.
So if bibless while lunching,
Indelicate munching
May lead to a need to redress.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
He was dubbed "Singing Cowboy," this man
Named Gene Autry who'd many a fan.
He'd a voice that was keen,
And each time on the screen
He'd be back in the saddle again.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
All your research is such a damn mess —
Calculations and facts in distress.
No footnotes or labels?
Statistical tables?
Exactness here's anyone's guess.

limerick_list.author: olwen
limerick_list.text:
An agate's no gateway, you see,
But a gemstone with markings quite free.
Made of quartz, it's diverse,
It's not hard on the purse,
And it's said to quell tempests at sea.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
From my heart, with a tear in my eye,
I declared, "If you drowned I would cry.
But the dedolent sea,
If it takes you from me,
Will not care if you live or you die."

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
A meteor needs many hours
To emaculate: see how she scours
The grime from her body
Till she shines like a hottie.
This occurs during meteor showers.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The sea between Ireland and Wales
Is the Celtic (to even the Gaels).
Deep beneath it, they've found
Oil and gas, which is bound
Now to pump up petroleum sales.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
French letters are nothing to read.
To succeed they're not quite guaranteed,
Yet if every man wore
One routinely before
He made love, fewer women would breed.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Only yesterday, John, Ringo, Paul,
And our George stood a hundred feet tall.
Now they let out a yelp
At performances: Help!
Are the mop-tops beginning to stall?

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Cefalexin's the name of a drug
That's prescribed when you're battling a bug
Like a bladder infection—
It'll change its direction!
You might give your doctor a hug!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The young Web struck a tubular mood:
All those pages of data we viewed
Were like waves on a sea
In the Netscape, so we
Said we cybersurfed. Gnarly, eh, dude?

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
In a welfare attempt gone awry,
The poor Dionnes just had to comply.
The quintuplets all grew
For nine years in a "zoo."
Far too late the concerned hue and cry.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I studied and thoroughly read
Many books on the baking of bread.
Now my speech is prepared,
I'm half dead," Tom declared
Exhaustively—then went to bed.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
I tried to hunt lions for sport.
Shot the face, so I had to resort
To stuffing his rear
For a trophy—oh, dear!
A catastrophe?  Yes, of a sort.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
The area measure, the are,
Has an area ten metres square.
Take ten and you'll make a
Not-quite-quarter acre.
A hundred?  A hectare is there!

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
The ball would have sailed past the flag,
If he'd swung, but he checked—made him gag.
Still, a steal was attempted,
But the out was pre-empted
'Cause the ump ruled no tag at the bag!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Strong emotions, resulting from pain
Taking root, got the better of Jane
When she shot her new groom
And best friend in their room.
She was found temporarily insane.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Oh, the Promised Land beckons in vain,
And that Rock Candy Mountain's a pain;
Shangri-la will not suit,
Nor Nirvana, to boot,
For I get all my kicks from Cockaigne.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
A handsome performer who crooned
Kissed a fan who had, over him, mooned.
When his tongue split her grin,
The girl's world seemed to spin,
And the dizzied young woman soon swooned.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
This garment's a girdle (or corset).
It's best pulled on gently, don't force it.
Upon its foundation
I've checked waist inflation,
And hence feel constrained to endorse it.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
The Cawdreys, a father and son,
Declared, "This great worke we'll not shunne,
Lest the Hebrew, the Greeke,
And the Latine we speake,
Leaue us unlearnned English undonne."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our interior fenestrate walls
Invite light to our stairways and halls.
In these windowed surroundings,
What's cool and astounding's
The sense that the space fairly sprawls.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Come and celebrate not being celibate,
Having someone with whom feelings gel a bit.
Here's to meetings of minds
And the physical kinds
Of affection that make bodies swell a bit.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
See my body shield, fat, black, and red?
It stops bullets that might make me dead.
It attaches right here,
To my arms. I've no fear
(That's unless I get shot in the h

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
I'm a rather strange farmer, I know,
'Cause I link the plants' stalks as they grow:
Bind the crops in their bed
With a needle and thread;
Next fall I will reap what I sew.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
England's Amesbury was old when the Dane
Gazed on Stonehenge upon Salisbury Plain.
Its namesake in Mass.
Guards the Merrimack's pass
Before Salisbury meets Gulf of Maine.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
This teapot is dripless; the lip
And the spout are designed not to drip.
As I pour, let me tell
Of my dating life hell —
All the drips.  You'll just flip.  Have a sip.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
A bed bug will bite in the night
And nothing you do gives it fright.
You can search till you're blue
In the face, but it's true
That it's gone when you turn on a light.

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
To travel to work and then home,
I've a cycle that's silver and chrome.
You may say they're the same
(All except for the name),
But it's bichrome's the point of this poem.

limerick_list.author: John Weigel
limerick_list.text:
They're aerophilatelic—my books,
And they're open for envious looks.
I possess such a set
Of these stamps that I bet
I could airmail a kitchen (with cooks)!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
We were boondocking, Edna and me,
In the woods in our Chevy RV.
There's no heat and no power,
No bath and no shower.
It sure ain't the Ritz, but it's free.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Horned dinosaurs traveled the road
To extinction, their fossils have showed.
Ceratopsia: brutes
Eating grasses and fruits,
And though starting out small, they jes growed.

limerick_list.author: limarico
limerick_list.text:
The cardinal directions are four.
In the morning you see the sun soar
From the East, then go West.
North and South are the rest.
Now relax! There will never be more.

limerick_list.author: John Ramos
limerick_list.text:
Beef tallow is rendered from suet.
It isn't a big job to do it.
Just trim a cow's fat,
Toss it into a vat,
And then turn on the heat source and brew it.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Caesarion's mother, it's plain,
Had grandiose plans in her brain:
"Little Caesar, my child!
I've delivered," she smiled—
"I'll make him the first in a chain."

limerick_list.author: Sella Turcica
limerick_list.text:
There's this guy at the bar named Jack Turner;
He's not from 'round here, he's a furriner.
We're not really cookin'
So I'm gonna keep lookin'
But I'm leaving him on the back-burner.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Hey sugar, your joke wasn't funny!
This stuff is too sticky and runny!
For a beautiful dish
Or a bidon I wish—
That's a tin that can hold all this honey!

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Though, for some, winter blues are unfurled
When it's dark, I'm contentedly curled
In a comfortable nook
With my laptop or book,
Thinking everything's right with the world.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Game chips are the counters you get
In gambling games, such as roulette,
In return for your cash
And, if feeling quite rash,
You may lose on a misguided bet.

Also, some folks will choose, for their meat,
Fresh cooked game which they eat till replete.
To go with it, are served
Game chips, these observed
To be thin crisp-like chips. Ain't that neat?

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
There once was a farmer named Jim
Who beamed, full of joy to the brim,
When he saw udders swell.
Bovine dames rang his bell.
(We don't know what the cows thought of him.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Belle's hotel has a posh clientele;
There the elegant, stylish folks dwell.
One small point gives her chills:
They are slow paying bills—
But these toffs seem to tip very well.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the Rockies, and famous worldwide,
Is the great Continental Divide.
There, at Nature's behest,
Waters flow east or west.
Which way's west? Guess I'll hire a guide.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Clearly dead on arrival, they said,
Was my plan for transplanting a head.
With no chance for success,
I've rethought it and, yes,
I should transplant the body instead.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you study the brain of a horse
That's inflamed (by a virus, of course),
There's a way to explain
What is causing the pain:
Alphavirus invading in force.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Children's games have a clean ebb and flow—
Simple rules in a simple tableau.
"Annie-over!" we call;
Friends unseen chase the ball.
Certain joys I've no wish to outgrow.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
Well, I don't quite believe it myself
When you say you're the child of an elf.
When you take a whole loaf
I believe you're an oaf;
Awful auf, put it back on the shelf!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cauliflower's so wretched, it's stunning!
And broccoli?  Worst Taste twelve years running.
There's a child?  I'm appalled!
Broccoflower it's called.
It's a hybrid I'm sure to be shunning.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The Army has soldiers who fight.
The Navy has sailors, all right.
The Marine Corps, I'm told,
Has marines, very bold,
While the Air Force has airmen in flight.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My grandpa, who grew up dirt-poor,
Had success as an entrepreneur,
Earning millions, and more,
When he reached forty-four.
"And I now," he explained, "feel secure!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Anapestic's the metre to use
When inspired by the limerick Muse
(Diddy-da, diddy-da).
There's an absolute bar
On using any other — just refuse!

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
There were two guys from Thailand that dined
On some food that was fresh, unrefined.
Said the first, "I'd be tickled
If veggies were pickled."
So they opened a store: Thais That Brined.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
We all know the regular robot,
But the factory uses a cobot:
When mere humans won't do
The machine pulls them through,
Till the power's off—then they've got no bot.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
It's not pretty to sit in this city,
Which is run by some standing committee
That has Ways and has Means,
Mind-benumbing routines,
And a band of Marines, more's the pity.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The site where the Twin Towers fell
Was "Ground Zero". Two pools fill the shell
Where foundations once were.
That whole day is a blur:
We were sad but still angry as hell.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Draped in flags, tightly packed, in the zone,
As a unit, they'll get up or groan.
The Olympics are here:
For their nations they cheer,
Chauvinistically backing their own.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
So you're after a doughty, white cotton?
French muslin's too flimsy.  It's rotten
For stout soldiers' gaiters
Or starchy, stiff waiters.
Try dowlas.  It's Scottish.  It's spot on.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Say a marriage of stars can't be healed
And the split of celebs is revealed.
In the case of Ms. Klum,
Does the public assume
It's her fault that the wedlock's un-Seal-ed?

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Her new love's like a runaway cart;
In a week it's "'Til death do us part."
Though her actions are rash,
And there might be a crash,
There's no way that she's braking her heart.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On various points, miscellaneous
(Some pertinent, others extraneous),
We twelve were accordant.
His humor, quite mordant,
Enforced a rapport consentaneous.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
As an aerialist, Kate's a humdinger.
With trapeze expertise, she's a ringer.
When I asked her one day
To a spouse-swap soiree,
She said, "No, I'm not that kind of swinger."

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Anonymous writings, I find,
Put a publishing house in a bind.
Though the book can't be sweller—
A likely best-seller—
By whom will the contract be signed?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Blotto painting: design made on paper
As a jest or a prank or a caper.
Take some paint (fresh, not old),
Drop on paper, and fold.
It's the squeezing of paint that's the shaper.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Good Samaritans help in a time
Of distress for, say, victims of crime
(Or that time, with a save,
I helped out when I gave,
To a writer's-blocked poet, a rhyme).

limerick_list.author: Randy Lee
limerick_list.text:
When you hunt with a Cheney or Fudd,
A gunshot can lead to a "Thud!"
So a good agent brings
Along Clorox and things
To remove every trace of the blood.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Tried to cram all the work, but it wouldn't.
Asked my sister for help (learned I shouldn't).
Then my pencils all broke,
And my dog had a stroke.
Cut a long story short? I just couldn't.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
I've a problem that strikes me as knotty;
My recall is frequently spotty.
So I tend to mis-greet
Most of those whom I meet.
I've even called Mark—my spouse!—"Scotty".

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The French, so I've heard, have a word
When a small contretemps has occurred:
When misfortune appears,
One repeatedly hears
Frenchmen muttering something like "murd".

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
While a courtier, favoured at court,
Was enlightened and wise and was thought
To be cultured, aesthetic,
Refined and poetic,
The whims of a king he'd not thwart.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The Bahamas, the Caymans, Belize
Measure temps using "F" in degrees.
That is Fahrenheit form
Which is also the norm
In US and Palau, boil to freeze.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For the hundred-centesimo lira,
I once bought a glass of Madeira,
But now it's maduros
I buy with my euros.
Say "ciao," my paisans, to that era.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
When new products fulfill your ambitions,
Their "approvals" bear certain conditions.
Never let the mains see
More than 30db
In the test of conducted emissions.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What are Esquimaux?" "Here's my report:
Native folk of a far-northern sort."
"Are you saying each wench
And male Inuit's French?
Do they snack on an Esquimau torte?"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
For cross-dressers, the ultimate shame
Is to wear something frumpy or tame.
At the bar, for a dare,
All the guys dressed as Cher,
But they had a good time all the same.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My earnestness?  Never in doubt!
Zeal and ardor are what I'm about.
Tasks smaller or bigger
I blitz with great vigor;
That's how I achieved Eagle Scout!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
When a paper's reporters attack,
Call on me if you want to hit back.
I can clean any mess
And square things with the  press.
It's my job, and I'm known as a flack.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Badly beaten, he clings to his life.
Swollen-eyed, he now glares at his wife.
"You damn little fool, it
Ain't worth it, just cool it!"
She's more than just trouble, she's strife!

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Buzzer beaters are shots that go in
At the very last second to win.
No more tied or ahead,
The opponents instead
Have to take the bad break on the chin.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
As the waiter delivered the bill,
With an "I will take care of this" thrill,
The cheapskate said, "Great!"
And left nil by the plate.
Comment backfired—he'd tapped his own till!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What's an exoplanet, Mom?" queried Janet.
"In deep space, our new telescopes scan it.
It orbits afar
Around some other star,
But it may seem like Earth, our home planet."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
We had lunch in my car, brought by Jeannie.
The choices were fine, servings teeny.
Sheep or fowl are preferred
Tasty mutton or bird,
(Lamb or guinea) in one's Lamborghini.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
"This leaf is acuminate."  "Why?"
"Tapers off to a point," I reply.
"But that also," you carp,
"As a verb, means 'make sharp'!"
"Don't talk back, or I'll poke out your eye!"

limerick_list.author: KeithArcher
limerick_list.text:
Why write this short ditty, you ask,
With a pseudonym here as a mask?
It's because I'm so witty
(Not to mention quite pretty),
And to bask in heaped praise is a task.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
To the left and the right of the sign
Known as equals expressions align
(That is if your math talents
Can make the two balance).
Equations — no talent of mine.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It means "catchingness". Contagiosity,
As a word, seems an awful monstrosity.
But consider contagiousness,
With much less outrageousness;
I'll use it without animosity.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A playboy, a bit on the wild side,
Conjoined with a gal on the mild side.
She said, "Don't wear a glove,"
'Cause she thought it was love,
But it wasn't.  She later, with child, sighed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My historical novel abounds
In gadzookery, true, on the grounds
It adds realness to plots
When my speakers use lots
Of expressions like "prithee" and "zounds!"

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
The British Film Institute's mission?
To preserve and restore the condition
Of great films from the past
So we see them at last —
BFI: we applaud your position.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"Your email attachment was broken,"
Wrote my manager. "Surely you're jokin',"
I replied. "It's a Word doc.
Not working? Absurd, doc."
"Enough!" he mailed. "Outlook has spoken."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Conglaciation's when things turn to ice;
I've seen that occur once or twice.
When I make tipsy passes
At fetching young lasses,
Their faces flash-freeze, which ain't nice!

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
Men delivering coal in November
Is something we old folks remember.
Down the coal chute it came
And I'm here to proclaim
That the coal kept us warm in December.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Some objectives you'll likely attain
On your own, to your personal gain,
But if help's to be sought,
You could drum up support
With a "common cause" kind of campaign.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
When the Age of Enlightenment dawned,
A new way of thinking was spawned.
Foundations were laid,
Discoveries made,
As the classical thinkers just yawned.
