limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Neo-Nazis appear in the news
Due to Endlösung: word Germans use,
Meaning Final Solution,
Extreme persecution,
Exterminate all of the Jews.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When I see French-cut string beans, I query:
What chef does a task that's so dreary
As to cut every bean
Cleanly lengthwise? I mean,
After ten or twelve beans, I'd be weary.

limerick_list.author: LaShel
limerick_list.text:
Mother squinted at Leigh down her nose:
"Now you've ruined your best pair of hose!
If you must take a knee,
Do it decorously.
Only lady-like girls get the beaus."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Apocalypse? Why, but of course!
I knew it would come with some force.
The way we're all dead,
And the sky has turned red,
And the four of you, each on a horse.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
From living here near the frontier
And dealing with horses, I fear
That part of me panics,
For aeromechanics
Have taught me, "steer clear of the rear."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My gal's gone and I'm sad. Though bone dry,
I may say that I'm damp and here's why:
This word I've selected
Equates to "dejected,"
A meaning that's long passed us by.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The new dentist, to tell you the truth,
Is a loudmouth and seems quite uncouth,
But the fellow's renown work
Includes making crownwork.
Hmmm...guess I'll bring him my bad tooth.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"U.S. alligator lizards," Kim wrote us,
"Just two genera — Teach won't promote us
If either one's missed
In our Anguidae list:
1. Elgaria
2. Gerrhonotus."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The Redeemer's returned!  It is true —
Make us great again, that's what he'll do.
No matter behavior,
You're our adored Savior:
Adoremus te, Trump!  We love You!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Must you bang on that agony box?
My head hurts clear down to my socks!
Can you play the piano?
I say, man oh man, no!
Your fingers all seem to be rocks.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Croatia's a state on the Med,
And forms part of the Balkans. It's said
To be hostile to Serbs
(It's been caught using verbs
Which disturb them, hence numerous dead).

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
CP's a disease with no cure,
So its victims must strive to endure.
With some poor muscle tone
Or a weakening bone,
They'll need plenty of help to mature.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
In dissecting my mind's aberration
I've uncovered a simple salvation.
Personality splits:
At the job one mind sits;
To the beach goes its mate — bilocation!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A bigmouth devoid of discretion
Not only revealed in confession,
But she blabbed in the pews.
Now we all know the news:
Father Vic is her carnal obsession.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
There's a cold northern wind off the sound —
Hard to run on this near-frozen ground.
Air so crisp and so dry
Burns my throat, stings my eye.
But it's helping — I'm nearly unwound.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Act of Union," in history, stands
As the law that unites different lands.
But to me such an act
Is coition—in fact
What our species' survival demands.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A chewet, I say with no lie,
Is defined as a meat kind of pie
And also a natterer,
Jackdaw and chatterer.
Such mixture of meanings seems wry.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
The old year is now down the drain,
And the holidays drove me insane.
At our Festivus meal
I made relatives feel
Feats of strength, and my right to complain.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
After twenty-plus years of relation,
Civil partnership prompts a libation.
We've got fallen arches
From all those Pride marches:
We've earned this conventionalization.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
MgFe3+(SO4)
2(OH)·7H2O ore:
It's botryogen, said
To be grape-like and red,
Or bright yellow in clusters galore.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For my friends who are given to fiddle
With words, here's an interesting riddle:
What's desiderable mean?
The answer is seen
If you drop the d e from the middle.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Save the snail darter," nature nuts squeak;
"They're exposed in this Tennessee creek."
Preservationists prayed
That our dam be delayed.
Ecological logic's damn weak!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
What intelligent planner's design
Could have bodied a species like mine,
With a corpus so poor
That it's hard to be sure
If intents were divine or malign?

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
Many students when wanting to crib'll
Write facts on their hands in a scribble
To stop them from failin'.
But why did Ms. Palin
Use notes?  So the public can quibble!

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Eddie Cantor, a favorite of mine,
I still think of whenever I dine.
I don't sit and recall
His routines—not at all—
I just drink Eddie Cantor of wine.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
We must classify mountains of tapes
That reveal these uncivilized apes.
For the world cannot see
How the monkeys run free,
All disguised in congressional shapes.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I have had a dispute with my wife,
And this argument's changing our life.
She declares that she's ripe
For a strong James Bond type
When, in truth, I am more Barney Fife.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Will society get to the stage
That the people of color we gauge
To be black, brown or red
Are more properly said
To be brownish or pinkish or beige?

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The cottontail rabbit looks sweet
With its white undertail and fleet feet.
But this small woodland rabbit
Has ticks. Make a habit
Of warding them off with some Deet.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
You're bewitchingly casting a hex
To compel me to ask you for sex,
But I'll counter your spell
With my own, mademoiselle,
Since you look... well, a lot like my ex.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The new barber shop earned every rave.
Want a buzz cut, a mullet, a wave?
Hair and face will look grand
If you stop in the land
Of goatee and the home of the shave.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
These abdominalia adhere
To an anchor, a boat, or a pier.
Only Barnacle Bill
Has the will and the skill
To keep everything cirriped-clear.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Must you acerbate granny afresh?
She's all tetchiness—live, in the flesh.
Now she's started to glower;
Hoobastank's turned her sour.
Show her mercy and play some John Tesh.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Working solo? The capo had not meant,
You alone should decide the allotment
Of our burglarized loot.
Work with us or we'll shoot—
No dispute if you join the complotment.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Sing 'A,' Joe!" the voice teacher cried.
"Open mouth! Let me see deep inside.
Give me A's. Now some ahs.
Joey, open those jaws
With your pharynx and lips also wide."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The tactics a general uses
To counter an enemy's ruses
Are likely to fail
If they merely entail
The irrational blowing of fuses.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Greenwich Mean Astronomical Time:
A term awkward and less than sublime,
Which was used to display
Passing hours of the day
Noon to noon at Meridian Prime.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A professor was heard to opine:
"Armed and dangerous?  Dumb by design!
It's a term I'd suggest
Is redundant at best.
Is there anyone 'armed and benign'?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Of all of the comic strip cops,
Most agree that Dick Tracy is tops.
As in real life, he shows
That in locking up foes,
Innovation (high tech) never stops.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Of detractors, DC has sufficiency;
If you live there, you'll note a deficiency
That is second to none
With the way that it's run:
Northern charm, mixed with Southern efficiency.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Next year Edie will be a collegian,
And she's eager to leave her home region.
Dad says, "That's really great.
You can go out-of-state."
(But the college she's picked is Norwegian.)

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Saul was blinded by light. Ananias
Told God, "Hey, I'm glad he can't eye us—
Saul is one holy terror."
Said God, "Just an error
Of judgment. Go cure him; he's pious."

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
When this main switch (said Albert) is thrown,
My precise calculations have shown
That these gang switches match
The main's signal they catch —
This design I now patently own.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
The actor keeps flubbing the scene
With emotionless work. Take fifteen:
When the boss shouts, "You're fired!"
All at once, he's inspired
And affectively venting his spleen.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
Ephedra can help you lose weight,
Give you jitters that just won't abate,
Put such strain on your heart
That it stops and won't start;
Then your friends will describe you as "late."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Peter Schickele's famous because
Of recordings and concerts he does
As he works 'round the clock
Pushing P.D.Q. Bach,
A great man who, in fact, never was.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Coney Island's in Brooklyn, I'd say,
Yet in Singapore, so far away,
There's an island whose name
Is exactly the same,
And in Ireland there's one (Sligo Bay).

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
For your valiant refusal to yield,
You may bear, by a bend half-concealed,
Our lion (debruised
So your arms aren't confused
With Our royalty). Praise to your shield.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
There was an old man with a beard—
Shaved it off! Said, "It's just as I feared:
I'm no longer a haven
For birds, now I'm shaven.
They've scarpered; they've all disappeared."

limerick_list.author: James Dobson and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My manhood had always impressed,
Till my threshhold for pain was assessed.
I wore a fixed grin
As the light burned my skin.
At two dols, though, I screamed, "Stop the test!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I'm a 'here and there' kind of a guy
(Going hither and thither). That's why
I prefer going out,
Unconfined—get about.
Yes, a 'to and fro' fellow am I.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Stephen Christmas was brought to his knees
By an illness that's bound to displease.
Docs found B hemophilia,
And said, "It can kill ya!"
And for him called it Christmas disease.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When Aries the Ram has connected
With our nannies the ram has selected,
Then your goats and my goats
Contribute their zygotes,
But "kids" would be most unexpected.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Male bears talk:  "So you need a new lair, too.
You can't live at home?"  "I can't bear to —
Can't abide it!"  "Me too!
Here's the thing we should do:
Find a boar cave we boars can repair to!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In my building, the rent isn't cheap,
So I trust that my neighbors will keep
Their CD players low
So their music won't grow
To that din one might call antisleep.

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
King Arthur once prayed, feeling strain,
For the end of a drought.  Not in vain—
Showers saved the crops sown,
And that time is now known
As the good days of King Arthur's reign.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If your lover and you are both nude
And enjoying an amorous mood,
Should her husband walk in,
This is crucial: don't grin,
Since to smirk at that point would be rude.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the ocean, "Fall off!" Captain roared.
Robert thought, "Is he out of his gourd?"
I'm sure he'll explain
With discussion profane,
After first pulling Bob back on board.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I know you're in love with the gal you met,
Since that morning when by the canal you met,
But it just isn't right
That you quarrel and fight.
It is high time you both smoked a calumet!

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Turning forty, I felt some remorse
When my wife, as a matter of course,
Asked, "So what would you like
For your birthday—a bike?"
And I answered with, "No, a divorce."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Biographical stuff can be tough.
If the graph of your life is too rough,
Every peak has its trough.
Stop! I want to get off—
All this up-and-down stuff is enough.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The rogues who appeared at Ma's gate
Said her rooftop was missing a slate.
They took money, then left;
She's been conned—and, bereft,
Found a fast one was pulled, but too late.

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
My sculpting's a sight to behold;
I use veggies when making my mould.
I make boulders from peas,
And some broccoli trees—
Mum says "Stop it! Your food will go cold!"

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
It now seems over-utilized; we're
Also guilty of this, so I fear—
Starting all that we say
With basically. May
It connote "bottom line"? "Let's be clear"?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When the lights first go out, I can't see;
Maybe waiting a while is the key:
After dark adaptation—
Acclimatization—
I'll be able to aim when I pee.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
At my door stood a man stooped and old,
Quite a sight and a fright to behold.
But he looked at me hard
And then offered his card:
Mephistopheles.  Lives bought ensouled.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
There are some folks grow corn for their skillet;
With others it's wheat-bun and fillet.
When bajra's as high
As an elephant's eye,
Then you know you are looking at millet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My illiterate ex, sexy Rex,
Who makes millions from oil wells in Tex.,
Sends me large monthly checks
That conform to my specs.
Not high-tech, each is signed with an X.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
"Drunk again?" said the doc to McGee,
"But a teetotal future you see?
Then clorazepate might
Be a help in your fight:
With this drug you will not get DT."

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
This delicious cake makes a great team
With strong coffee that's topped with fresh cream—
Just single, not double,
But real ('cos the trouble
Is fake stuff will ruin the dream).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When a  cell splits in two—cell division—
It performs with amazing precision.
A cell bridge may connect
Daughter cells, that's correct,
But it breaks without needing excision.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
My charming oncologist said:
"Eaton-Lambert's a syndrome to dread.
In your lung there's a tumour,
But keep of good humour—
There's time to be sad once you're dead."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Queenie's barely inside her bikini.
Parts pop out as the thing is so teeny.
She is bountifully breasted
And could be arrested:
Indecent exposure by Queenie.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Considerable thought we invested
In McCarrot. Our rabbits have tested
These glorified meals,
Which produced joyful squeals,
But, alas, too much gas when digested.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Apathetic. Don't care. Oh, whatever.
Today, or tomorrow, or never.
Indifferent, blasé.
Just go do it your way.
Wake me up when you say something clever.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
When you go on an argument spree,
And you shout it's just you who can see,
That the truth is all yours,
Your opponents are boors,
You're just barking, and up the wrong tree.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Confining her rage to a simmer,
She surveyed Bertram's work with the strimmer.
Not a flower was left.
"Bert, of brains you're bereft!"
Cried his mum, "Not just daft, even dimmer!"

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Mrs. Beeton, whose excellent book
Taught Victorian England to cook,
Would have sooner served nude
Than cook microwaved food.
Dear, I'm begging you, please, take a look!

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
"Let them eat it!" reportedly said 
The young queen with the curls on her head
Piled up halfway to Heaven.
It's sweet and has leaven—
It's quite the best thing, next to bread.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Have you heard of François de Civille?
He's the man even Death couldn't kill.
Well, at least not at first,
And his end, so rehearsed,
Left a legend that's talked about still.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The dragon, though tiny, was spinulated.
His spine, for defense, was echinulated.
Each prickle that rose
Could bring death, Heaven knows,
Since each barb was, in fact, acuminulated.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
The sea's backset can sure set you back.
It's an eddy that packs quite a smack,
For it flows back to front.
It's a huge current shunt.
It means  "setback", too?  Man, that's just wack!

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
In the physically fit revolutions,
Flat abs make such strong contributions.
For chances increased
Try consulting a priest.
They are specialists — seek ab-solutions.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I read blurbs on the back.  In the flaps,
I read summarized contents.  Perhaps
If the book jacket's piquing
My interest, I'm seeking
The middle to fill in the gaps.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Our punkie crop's shrunk! He — the monkey,
That spunky grey punk — he has slunk! He
Is quick, and too slick
For the calabash trick!
It is bunk! He's no flunky to punkie!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Canny cannibals, joining the Greens,
Cooking healthier vegan cuisines,
Found that tofu would do
In their cannibal stew—
Though their bean curd required human beans.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Here's the countdown—there's three, two, then ONE!
We have lift-off! It's NASA's top gun,
A fiery-tailed zinger—
A high-tech humdinger—
Earth is ditched, it's been mooned on the run!

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
There are things that become more alluring
As with each passing day they're maturing.
Bonds are one; fine wines, too.
As for elderly you,
Well... whatever you find reassuring...

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A golfer who's out on the course
Finds an herb in the woods by the gorse.
It's the centaury—key
To his needing to pee,
So he's seeing a man 'bout a horse.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My Theresa has got beriberi.
I confessed, "This is quite scary, Terry.
It is thiamine, Love,
You don't get enough of,
And the doctors are all very wary."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The sulfonimide sulfamethoxazole
(Not the other one—called sulfisoxazole)
With trimethoprim mixed
Has bacteria nixed
In the medicine called co-trimoxazole.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Chameleon? No, I'm more lowly;
I'm only a humble anole.
My colours might change,
But the New World's my range,
And iguanas my kin (though not wholly).

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
With a search for uranium came
Descurainia's moment of fame:
Where this weedy plant grew
It provided a clue
(Then no more, after short-lived acclaim).

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In a cross its four petals are laid;
On each petal His blood is displayed.
Let each blossom remind us
And faithfully bind us
Each spring when the dogwood's arrayed.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
My girlfriend and I—coexistent:
Alive at the same time, not distant.
That works out just great
When we go on a date,
'Cause I'm sure I'm time-travel resistant.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Days gone by, needful guys asked for aidance,
And for digging their soil used a spadance.
(The latter's not true,
To be honest with you,
But it fits pretty well in the cadence.)

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
New Bonapartism around
1850 in Europe was found:
The old Emperor's glory
Now gilt the bad story
Of millions of dead in the ground.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
They always end up being downers,
So I strive to avoid these encounters.
A chance meeting's no crime,
But the problem is I'm
Xenophobic, and they're out-of-towners.

limerick_list.author: Dave Barber and Matt Barber
limerick_list.text:
The genes of the pale Anglo Saxon
Give features like hair that is flaxen,
A nose that is spare,
And skin that is fair.
(For example, check out Michael Jackson.)

limerick_list.author: RCK
limerick_list.text:
Afforestation afficionado
Named Johnny went by a strict motto:
First pull all the weeds,
Then insert the seeds —
The apple tree, not the tomato.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Coralligenous reefs are too few.
Don't steal coral, I'm begging of you!
It's a loathsome mistake
Since replacements can take
Sometimes decades to grow back anew.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Old Gus was agog over Gertie,
But Gertie was so falsely flirty.
His cronies said, "Yo Gus,
That Gertie is bogus."
Sighed Gus, "But authentically purty."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said my cousin who comes from Bulgaria:
"Here's a plant that won't live in aquaria.
It's from Europe, I know,
But in Texas you grow
It for fodder. It's called alfileria."

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
Tiny combs to catch nits, vile shampoo:
These are tools to fight head lice.   What's new
In this sickening fight:
There's no stigma!   That's right.
The whole school is delousing now, too.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
We confirm that your retina's detached,
But your doc's reputation's unmatched.
He'll secure it with glue
And the tongue from a shoe
And an eye bolt to keep it all patched.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Your son's failing," the principal said.
"There'll be no graduation for Ted.
On his head he won't wear
The school's mortarboard. There
We'll be placing a dunce cap instead."

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
Here's a funny old game to play, Bob:
Put your fingers inside of your gob.
Now stretch out your grin
To both sides of your chin,
And say "Banking's a banker's top job!"

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
In the scheme of things feudal, the freemen
Were only quite minor (or wee) men.
A vill contained ten
Of these stout English men.
And a demivill? Two more than three men.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Creatures down by the salty sea's bed
Have front legs that protrude past their head;
These crustaceans grab food
With their pincers (quite rude) —
If you're barefoot, watch out where you tread.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Rare gemstones so finely engraved
He amassed and eternally craved,
Says this latest biography.
Antique dactyliography
Was the art by which Sam was enslaved.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Go covertly. Knock Phelps down de steps.
Doan git caught." "Dat's a chance ah accepts!
Sneaky's easy to do.
Should ah be angry too?"
"Yew doan hafta be mad, but it heps."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I'd intended to get there the rich way,
But it turns out I'll go any which way.
Am I loose? No, I'm not,
So I'm proud that I got
Here at last, not too much of the bitch way.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Is your decking concave or convex?
Are its surfaces wavy, complex?
They'll be made right as rain
With my circular plane
And its action in finishing decks.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Aransas Pass leads to a bay
On the Texas Gulf Coast.  Every day,
In a salt-water file,
Ships will pass Mustang Isle
To the south; to the north, San José.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Mind your sass, show respect to your teacher;
Hold your tongue in God's house with the preacher.
Acting briggity's fitting,
The occasion permitting.
In a squirt, it's a bothersome feature.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
But your logic is stuck — it won't move
From its circular argument's groove.
Yes, the sole valid "hence..."
Is: you're lacking in sense —
You assumed what you wanted to prove!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Handsome Dan—what a man—lean and lanky,
Made Sandy, his wife, awfully cranky.
She couldn't restrain
Him; she'd whine and complain
When she caught him in frank hanky-panky.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Once his brewery opened its doors,
There were profits for young Adolph Coors.
With Clear Creek as a source
And his know-how, perforce
His name's golden, in taverns and stores.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Diarrhoeic infirmity hits!
And again! He has feverish fits
Which are energy-draining
And underwear staining.
His caboose? Fast and loose. It's the pits.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Faamafu is brewed in Samoa
From stuff they can easily grow—a
Potato, malt, sugar;
While watching the rugger
It's just the right tipple to lower.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Many years back a bright engineer
Invented the smart bevel gear.
This cunning new notion
Could alter the motion
Of a drive from the side to the rear.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
It's a loud-celebrations-and-mirth-day,
And a what-have-these-years-all-been-worth?-day.
Thirteen springs since your birth —
Well, whatever they're worth,
Zoe Lou, have a rockin' good birthday.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Driving homewards, I hit some poor critter;
Decided to cook up a fritter.
Deep-fried it in batter,
Tucked in — what's the matter?
"Delicious," I tweeted on Twitter!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A caprice is a product of whimsy,
Whose rational basis is flimsy—
Like writing a verse
On the Jabberwock's curse
Using brillig, galumphing, and mimsy.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Empirically speaking, I know
(As I've seen them) live coals warmly glow.
Furthermore (this is lyrical),
Lo! They're empyrical.
Webster, my friend, tells us so.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
There once was a man, name of Tolkien,
Of whom much is written and spolkien.
I just read his book,
'Bout the ring Bilbo took—
Favorite part's when the fellowship's brolkien.

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
Said a folder with firmly set shoulders
To a group of assembled beholders,
"I'll fold for the old
And the brave and the bold,
But I'll never fold folders for folders."

limerick_list.author: Comicoffee
limerick_list.text:
Don't you think it's a little ironic
Your mom claims she's not histrionic?
She's quite angel-seeming
On days she's not screaming
Or downing her tenth gin and tonic!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm enjoying the censorship game,
Dressing ribaldry up to seem tame,
Using double entendres
To hornswoggle launderers
Of prose, for whom sex equals shame.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
In new Cuba, Fidel would hold sway
With great help from a leftist named Che.
This agent insertable,
A Castro convertible,
Scared despot Batista away.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Deep within the small egg there are surges,
Then eclosion — that is, there emerges
A larva, set free
On the leaf of a tree,
Where it feeds to fulfill basic urges.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Yves' accentedness went to my head,
When he looked in my eyes and then said:
"I have marre — 'ow you say?
You me make dégoûté,"
And it sounded like: "Take me to bed."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's the nicest of uncles in Nice
Who enjoys finding rocks by caprice.
When he chances on slices
Of granites and gneisses,
He sends all his nieces a piece.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
All hail to our fake news provider,
Our unhinged, unenlightened decider,
Who through unchecked derision
Engenders division:
God bless you, D. Trump, Great Divider!

limerick_list.author: DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
A "B" at the top of your test
Denotes that you're not quite the best.
While "A+" receivers
Are over-achievers,
You're there in the back with the rest.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Near the mousehole old Pusscat would wait
For the mousie to come for the bait—
A chunk of aged Cheddar;
But mousie knew better,
Thus foiling a fat-feline fate.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
If you're harried or haunted by hair
Which you feel simply shouldn't be there,
Electrologists will
Use their follicle skill
To resolve this distasteful affair.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
If a limerick, lewd in its mood,
Is too heavily weighted with crude,
Then it's one to detest.
Innuendo is best—
For a verse that just hints at what's rude.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Bob's an FTF case: failed to fly.
Tried to kill himself—just didn't die.
For his effort inept,
Who'd have thought, when he leapt,
Twelve full floors insufficiently high.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Mama's bridge club is mad to the core.
Their folie is so hard to ignore.
See, they make little farts
When they want to bid hearts,
And they glue all their cards to the floor.

limerick_list.author: Dick C. Erd
limerick_list.text:
After lunch Captain Crunch was declaring,
O'er the roar of the Sea in the Bering,
"'Twas the best allice shad
That I ever have had,
So I hope I'm not losing my herring."

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Now cr- has been opened up, so
Let me check on how far I can go...
Ah, crystoleum. This
Was a process some miss
For preserving (in glass) Baby Joe.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
While one kitten plays  bat, pull and shove it all,
The other, with rubs, says, "I love it all."
Their elders ignore
Foolish fluff on the floor
From a shelf — high, aloof and above it all.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
I'm amazed at his boundless capacity
For truth-stretching! Downright mendacity!
His facts' elasticity
And inauthenticity
Give reason to doubt his veracity.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
I once owned a Chrysler — it stunk!
And my spouse's new Fiat — more junk!
Once their merger is made,
They'll have lemons to trade,
But no money will car buyers plunk!

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
My favorite footwear's  bare feet.
I think farmyard aromas are sweet.
I'm a country gal! I
Breathe pollution-free sky
As I gaze upon fields of ripe wheat.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Bumped a nest full of hornets at rest,
And the action came fast, unsuppressed.
The response: energetic,
Confused, wild, frenetic.
(The hornets seemed equally stressed.)

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
The arrivers are those who appear
On the scene to a great joyous cheer.
Whether early or late
To a great party date,
Let the fun now begin...they are here!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren and proof
limerick_list.text:
As the man stands in court in the dock,
The judge is soon handed a clock:
It stopped dead at the time
Of the dastardly crime.
It's Exhibit B now. (A's a wok!)

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
Do you wonder what makes lemons sour?
What in grapefruit juice makes you feel dour*?
It's that acid called citric
Which cleans all things vitric
And gives little limes pucker power!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
At the Automat, Chicken Supreme
Or blueberry pie with whipped cream—
Insert coins, open door,
Tasty tidbits galore
On the spot—an automaton's dream!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The embankment we're building — a berm —
Will help drainage, our textbooks confirm.
I suggested a ditch,
But it seems there's a hitch:
We don't learn that until second term.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Jack's assigned a new area code,
Ostensibly, easing the load
Caused by cellphones and faxes.
"But overlays," Jack says,
"Are taxing, our survey just showed."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Though you couldn't go into the wood,
And you wouldn't have gone if you could,
I believe that you might
When conditions are right,
If you think that you can and you should.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
With a goal at each end — mine and thine,
Today's football game got off just fine.
As the ball I kicked met,
Though, the back of the net,
I did wish the net hadn't been mine.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
It was Judy, my ex, who did still me.
She had zero insurance until me.
The local judiciary
Named Jude beneficiary.
Were I living, my widow would kill me!

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Noble knight, thou art truly a sight,
As thy mail drips with blood from the fight.
So discase thine apparel
Or else wear a barrel.
Merlin's Cave's got roast boar on tonight!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
There are those who convincingly say
Amphioxidae showed us the way.
Those lancelets all lack bone,
Yet hinted at backbone—
And that's why you have one today.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"Da Da Da, Da Da Da, Da Da Da,
Da Da Da, Da Da Da, Da Da Da."
 This one word Tommy had,
Which  popped out just for Dad,
"Da Da Da, Da Da Da, Da Da Da."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Her cheeks are aflame with a rosiness
Revealing the shame of her nosiness.
She's seeking to hide
As she's peeking inside
At a couple who snuggle in coziness.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Once tough drovers steered cattle and sheep
Over tracks, often rocky and steep.
They would journey for days.
There was scant time to graze
And, till markets were reached, little sleep.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Tempestuous winds swirl and blow,
And a scent in the air speaks of snow.
Every offshoot and bough
Bears a cicatrice now
Where each beautiful leaf used to grow.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I was twenty — I'm now twenty-one.
Another great year has begun.
'Twas this date when my birth
Brought me onto this Earth.
It's my birthday!  Now let's have some fun!

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
When you jump from a plane, falling free,
Then awareness of altitude's key.
If you lose it, you'll find
Mother earth most unkind—
Or great gratefulness for AAD.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
They were backing up files when it went.
He'd a hunch just a third had been sent.
Said Richard to Rose,
"The hard drive just froze.
Now's the winter of our disk content."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The image my mirror reflects
Isn't me, as, in many respects,
It's unable to capture
My traits that enrapture,
And characteristics that vex.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
"A blockhead gets crispy," I say,
"When assaulted and battered." I stay
Far away, with my wok
Heating oil, until KNOCK!
Then I batter his head, just in play.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Taking brunch on the branch of our tree,
Sat old Corvus and Robin and Me.
Though in Pussy's attack,
Feathers flew, red and black,
We've a neat pile of fur. Come and see.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Yonder maiden I spy is a belle. A
Bold feller I am, so I'll tell 'er.
(Love to loosen thy corset —
Gadzooks, lad, don't force it.)
"Thy donzel salutes damosella."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If depression is making you cry,
You might take an SSRI,
And it might be Celexa;
Melancholia wrecks a
Man's life, so it's sure worth a try!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In our ternary mind, there's conation—
The part that controls activation,
Including volition.
It isn't cognition,
Or emotion, like joy or frustration.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB and nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
To my niece, who seems never to cease
Finding parts of my car to degrease:
"Drop the rag! Give me peace!
Quit your silly caprice!
I don't own it; it's just on a lease."

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
In the kitchen, you'll find me uncoachable,
Though I'm perfectly nice and approachable.
I welcome the tips
From your competent lips.
But for me an egg just isn't poachable.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Immigration is picky about
Just who enters this country, no doubt.
If it's drugs that you're on,
Or you're some kind of con,
You're excludable. Stay the hell out!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Betty baked me a boggy top pie.
Tangy apples and quince met my eye.
As for top crust, there's none.
Betty's never made one,
But she'll learn how that's done by and by.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Slutty School Girls is not what you'd call
Edutainment.  This movie's a ball,
And it sure entertains.
But enriching your brains?
Educational?  No, not at all.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The toy Digger the Dog has a cap
Just like Holmes.  Pull his string, and he'll yap
And start sniffing the ground
As you wheel him around,
And you won't have to scoop any crap.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Unmarried and pregnant (caught short),
Doris lost in paternity court.
Having slept with six guys
And proclaimed umpteen lies,
Case and kid she felt forced to abort.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
There was Keaton, and Kilmer, now Ben.
Oh yeah Clooney and Bale, 'member when?
But who played him best?
My vote goes to West
With KA-POW, BAM and PHOOM, he's a 10!

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
A robot was proud of the house
That he shared with an android—his spouse.
"It's as neat as a pin"
He announced with a grin,
"And when pins stick to skin I degauss."

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
On Ascension there's quite a commotion!
At this minuscule speck in the ocean
A ship has arrived,
And its crew has contrived
To win all the young ladies' devotion!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Stir your bones, twerp, and gear up the mule,"
Sis demands; she must think me a fool.
Bessie bridles at bridling.
She druther stand idling
Than hitch to some burdensome tool.

limerick_list.author: Prolix3
limerick_list.text:
Yes, the hair lab reports that you rate a
Really dismal result on your data.
With tress loss progressive,
And shedding excessive,
You have alopecia areata.

limerick_list.author: willupanek
limerick_list.text:
Aphaeretic are words such as bound,
Once abound has thus dropped its lead sound.
So raccoon becomes coon,
And attune becomes tune.
Underground, dropping two, becomes ground.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When my parents got married, they pledged
To live happily; both of them hedged.
Now they're backbiting; that's
Sort of fighting like cats,
But with slander, sarcastically edged.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
I know billiards is really quite tame,
But it's all we can play, such a shame.
Of course snooker's more fun,
But when all's said and done,
We just don't have the balls for the game.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
They are two out of six in the nest;
Each is ten times as long as the rest.
Ces oeufs (to the Gallic)
Are brazenly phallic.
What are they?  Freud eggs, I suggest.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Is a cryptogam some kind of code
Or a grave where a body is stowed,
Or a plant that's among us?
It's a fern, moss or fungus,
Reproducing by spores that explode.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Dallas, Texas: the site on the day
That Lee Harvey dispatched JFK.
Did he act all alone?
Was he merely a drone?
A conspiracy, some people say.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
José got a can on, he swore.
Juliet's got a cob on. She's sore.
Drunk, and angry, they mean,
Though I never have seen
Either one of these phrases before.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
On the river today it's not nice.
There are numerous fragments of ice —
So much brash ice afloat,
You should not row your boat
Nor go swimming, is my sage advice.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
So caught up in his cheeseparing ways,
Will's a miser—the guy never pays!
If you hand him the bill,
He turns violently ill.
Parsimonious Me! (His catchphrase.)

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
To electrodeposit a metal
Onto surfaces like on your kettle,
You'll need salt baths and juice.
Enough volts will induce
Metal ions to plate (that is, settle).

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
My libido I've kept in a headlock:
With my celibate vow there was deadlock.
But it's getting much harder
To stifle my ardour
Since finding I'd just forsworn wedlock.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Your great-uncle is what you'd expect.
It's your mom or dad's uncle. (I checked.)
And although it looks odd,
It's the truth, swear to God,
The term granduncle's also correct.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I see red when we're having a blue.
I'm browned off; black and white is my view.
There's no grey: I am right,
You are wrong; so we fight.
Black and blue, we'll both be when we're through.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The barn owl is also the white,
Golden, silver, screech, scritch, straw, and night,
Hissing, hobgoblin, rat,
Church, or death owl (How's that?)
Plus there's quite a few more I could write...

...at great length, which I'll do here and now. Let
Me list Billy wise, gilly owlet,
Owlerd, hobby owl, padge,
Moggy, cherubim, Madge,
Barnyard, dylluan wen, gillihowlett.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Nick the Nicker's career was hand-picked—
Stealing briefs meant his boxes were ticked.
A cop caught him red-handed
And issued a candid
"Drop those knickers you nicked, Nick. You're nicked!"

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
No two Cabbage Patch Kids are the same,
And each one of them has its own name.
These Coleco-made toys
Were for girls and for boys.
They brought Xavier Roberts great fame.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
"You don't pay us enough — we want more!"
Said the girls on the factory floor.
"Equal work, equal pay!"
Was the cry of the day,
So the Equal Pay Act became law.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
In the top of my bachelor's chest,
There's a slide that pulls out: I am blessed
With a low set of drawers
That this writer adores —
It's well used in my author-ised nest.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
When Phil kicks a ball it won't roll;
It will fly like the wind through a hole.
This one glanced off my head,
Barely touched, but they said,
"Well placed; a superb headed goal!"

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Cloudless azure, no misty-moist gray —
How I love an enubilous day!
This transparency rarity,
Crystalline clarity,
Sparkles like words can't convey.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Whilst my part is just that of a sub,
I've been longing to play for this club.
Though my role's complemental,
In the field I'm not gentle.
Should I play, then I will be the hub.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Sit upright and center your dorsal in,
Then carefully dribble your morsel in;
And when your excretion
Is done to completion,
It has to be flushed down the porcelain.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"Mr. Howard" felt nothing untoward,
So he turned with his back to Bob Ford.
With one shot through the head
Jesse James fell down dead,
And his killer sought out his reward.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'm enfeloned — I burn so today
With a bitter, fierce anger.  You say
You betrayed me again
With not one, but two men.
Let me see…that makes ten. Go away!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"When Ted left me, I really was mad,
So I spent all the cash that we had,
On my pleasures, indulgently;
Now I'm glowing effulgently.
Like my new Lamborghini?" "Not bad!"

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Banning reading material looks
Like big business, though not one for crooks.
Yet some folks look askance
(At the big bonfire dance)
At the way they are cooking the books.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Not a trip to the balmy Bahamas
Nor a voyage like Vasco da Gama's
'Neath Taurus nor Libra
Will score us a zebra—
An equine who wears striped pajamas.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
It's a no to gods other than me,
Disrespect, idol worshipping, see?
You can wail, "That's enough!"
When I catechise. Tough!
(Like the seventh commandment can be.)

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
In your grandmother's day (you'd forgotten?)
The bathing suit fashions were rotten.
With their skirts and their frills
They provided few thrills,
Whereas now—they're just slivers of cotton!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
John F. Kennedy told us, "Ask not
What your country can do, dot, dot, dot."
Now that notion's reversed.
A Big Government thirst
Has some ask, "How'd we get to this spot?"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Said Adam to God, "Wait. Don't leave.
I'm alone on this world, I perceive.
Do the magic you do —
Take a spare rib or two
And corporify eye-catching Eve."

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
"Your old expergefactor has rusted;
Its reveille is not to be trusted.
Here's your morning Earl Grey."
"What on earth did you say?"
"Your alarm clock, young master, is busted."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A goddess who never liked peace,
Ancient Eris brought discord to Greece:
Disagreement, suspension
Of order, dissension,
Contention—did I mention dissent, strife, chaos, anarchy, bedlam, turmoil, and the flouting of society's rules without cease?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Today I was really impressed
At the rate Bessie's food can digest.
She ate apples at ten;
They were broken down, then
She excreted the pips on request.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
If your lab has an under-suppliance
Of scientists, citizen science
Can provide you with many
More colleagues than any
Recruiter: a public alliance.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Rhett bragged of a horse he had vetted:
Betz placed grudging wagers and fretted.
Rhett urged him to go
And bet all of his dough:
Rhett abetted the bets Betz had betted.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A biologist goes to the mall
To examine the lives, big and small,
Of the gals who are shopping
Without even stopping
Or dropping—buyologists all!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Alluring Lureen has me under
A spell, and I fear I may blunder
When I ask for a date.
My admirative state
Has me dizzy with awe and with wonder.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our homework assignment, coercive,
Was reading an essay, discursive,
That skimmed many topics,
From Maine to the tropics.
I'll skip it. I'm feeling subversive.

limerick_list.author: jeux
limerick_list.text:
I crave to pour hugs on some lass,
With unlimited kisses en masse.
Is there anything sexier,
Than acute basorexia?
If no lass, I must kiss someone's...

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Jerked contractions — I'm someone who has 'em.
My muscles endure tonic spasm.
So yes, I'm entastic,
And folks get sarcastic;
They mock when I razzamatazz 'em.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Give me four baconburgers with cheese
And a large side of fries, if you please."
Lots of salt, lots of fat,
Lots of sweets and all that—
What's the final result?  Heart disease.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
My dress-conscious friend (what a toff!)
Wears his hamster-pelt coat—don't you scoff!
Maybe that explains why,
Having tried London's Eye,
He's addicted—I can't get him off!

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
When your innards are hurting and troubled,
And your pain is so bad that you're doubled,
Electron microscopy
After endoscopy
Might show you're malignantly nubbled.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Our financial position is dicey,"
I said to my wife. "Some things I see
Aren't needed, e.g.,
The designer TP.
Diseconomy, sweetheart, is pricey."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
He's a blood-sucking usurer gent
Who'll demand for each pound he has lent
That you pay him back two.
Give the devil his due,
That old Shylock the Jew shent-per-shent.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Callipygian people reveal
Rounded rears, shapely butts; they're ideal.
Others try toning glutes,
But they'll never have beauts.
Bottom line: they lack J. Lo's appeal.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
Damon feared that his chances were sunk,
And his spirits were deep in a funk.
But at last, when he learned
That his friend had returned,
They went out and got Pyth-i-ass drunk.

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
This nightclub's the hottest in town!
Not a person is sporting a frown.
And they're up to the times
When it comes to rap rhymes;
When the DJ gets "Down," they get down.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Today's anthropologist traces
"Indigenous" customs and places.
Before, agriology
(Sans an apology)
Studied "uncivilized" races.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He gave his old suit a quick brush
And was out of the house in a rush.
Now the cat hairs are gone
As he runs cross the lawn
And falls flat on his face in the slush.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
I store plasma and tissue and pee,
And I serve as a kind of trustee
For samples so rare
That they need special care.
I'm a biobank—run for a fee.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
If we take my new camera from Sears,
We can shoot at Sauzon once it clears;
Then Cancale, by the sea,
And Le Croisic makes three—
We'll have photos of Brittany's piers.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"So you think you're all that?"  "Yes, I do.
I'm as good as they get, through and through."
"That's no way to play, man,
With your number one fan
Being narcissist, self-obsessed you."

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
The term blackdamp's an ominous word.
It is also called chokedamp, I've heard.
It will cut off one's breath,
(Without oxygen—death)
And a mining disaster's occurred.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Now that Grandpa's got over his gout,
Why," I asked, "ain't he up and about?"
Mom replied, "He's all right.
He was dancing all night;
He's just dog-tired—plum tuckered out."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To see hoodoos en masse, visit Bryce
Canyon National Park. Been there twice.
The first time they saw some
My kids said, "They're awesome!"
But the next time, as teens, yawned, "They're nice."

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
That our Nation, against every Odd,
Overseen by a vigilant God,
Hath sprung up and remained
Doth suggest we have gained
(Deus annuit coeptis) His Nod.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
When tobacconists throw in a casing,
It's not natural-flavor-replacing,
But a hint of a berry,
Or anise, or sherry —
Some call it tobacco debasing.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
The cobby cats' legs are quite squat;
Like the slim Siamese they are not.
But they're held in repute
And their faces are cute
With the broad snubby noses they've got.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Foreign policy can be a killer, son.
Not a job for Steves Bannon or Miller, son.
Jared, be my first mate.
Helm our new ship of state.
I'll move Rex far away from the tiller, son.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What is dicrotism? That means the beat
Of your heart makes two bounces, discrete,
In the pulse at your wrist.
Such a pulse, I insist
Is a twist that is wonderfully neat!

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Ingratitude sucks—I mean, seriously.
It smarts and it stings deleteriously.
I can't wait for old age
To allow me to rage
At its serpent's-tooth sharpness, King Leariously.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
If your right lung collapses, you'll free
Up some space.  (This has happened to me.)
Since my heart had a mission
For dextroposition,
I find now I vote GOP.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
In default of the sheriff (who's wiser),
And the coroner (next best advisor),
It's your job to pick
Out the jurymen, Dick;
So you really do little, elisor.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
Antiphonal musical folk
Found out in the time pre-Baroque
Two alternate choirs
Of singers and lyres
Can please any stereo bloke.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
A coronagraph's second to none
When it comes to obscuring the sun.
And without the sun's glare
One can see every flare,
And get solar photography done.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For lovers, this river is sure
To possess an uncommon allure.
It's in Asia and flows
To the east, where it goes
To a strait. And its name? The Amur!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Noam Chomsky debunked B. F. Skinner
As he learned from each toddler beginner
That our brains are hard-wired;
There's no training required —
Grammar's sources aren't outer, but inner.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
The doc, a fine diagnostician,
Immediately knew her condition;
Her ear, quite acute,
Had switched over to "mute",
Because rap offends any musician.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
It's not that I hate you as such,
Nor yet that you cost me that much,
But I want that 2p
Lent in '73.
Still, I'm not one to carry a grutch.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
You will know, if you own your own dog,
That he's easily thrilled and agog.
Though asleep on your bed,
Just a nod of your head,
And he'll leap off to bark at a mog.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I was clocked at one hundred and three.
Was this fair? Only to a degree;
Though the motorway cop
Flashed his lights and yelled "STOP!"
When you're drunk, how the hell can you see?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Uncle Gustav talked nature with ease,
Like the Latinate labels for trees:
"That's a beech," he'd say, "Fagus."
"Sure, whatever you say, Gus.
Let's move on to the birds and the bees."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
For long years it had followed a pattern:
Making rounds like some space-walking slattern,
Through light and through dark,
Till it found its true mark.
Now Cassini has mated with Saturn.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
There's a color that's specially made
Just for boys, as a gender mark aid.
It's a very light blue,
Touched with green (purple, too).
Baby blue is the name of this shade.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Some say humans and dinosaurs met.
Those two life forms coeval; you bet.
But let's not be mendacious —
Were cavemen Cretaceous?
Fred Flintstone with Dino? Err. . . Nyet!

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The committee met early to set
This year's theme for the dance. On a bet,
I said maize would be great.
They said, "That's, we must state,
The most cornball idea we've heard yet!"

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Acaridae, family whose mites
Have eight tiny legs but big bites,
Infests hives of bees
Or cornmeal, dried peas.
Some bit me; I scratched twenty nights!

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
"Ah, it's April in Paris, Miss Fay,
And amour's in the air — oui, c'est vrai!"
"Whoa now, hold on there, Bucky!
This is Paris, Kentucky,
And Main Street's no Champs-Elysées."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
What are chalcogens? Here is the poop
On the elements making this group:
From oxygen (top)
Go down till you stop:
Livermorium—that's the whole scoop.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Off to Hell was sent fast-talker Dick.
But that eloquent trickster was slick:
He received a reprieve.
But in Phoenix on leave,
Tweeted, "Lucifer, yank me back quick!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn and Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A viola looks naked without
Any purfling adorning each bout.
Front and back are inlaid
Both for looks, and to aid
Inhibition of splitting, no doubt.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Milk is best if it's used by the date
On the carton.  This morning at 8,
I went down for a cup,
But I nearly threw up.
Seems I made me some cafe au late.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
When every day feels like a chase,
Then it's time for a nice change of pace.
So you shift your location
And go on vacation —
Then return like a rat to the race.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A wet-bulb thermometer's used,
With a dry-bulb thermometer fused,
To get a psychrometer.
This type of hygrometer
Keeps moisture observers amused.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Is there witchery here, my good sir?
There's no breeze, but the seed-head's a-stir."
"Sir, 'tis nothing so strange,
Just humidity's change
Makes the animated oat-dance occur."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Oddjob first  used his hat to deliver
A smashing hard blow to disshiver
A statue, to scare
Mr. Bond. But his glare
Couldn't make that cool master-spy quiver.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Shepherd Tom's favorite buck had dropped dead,
So he took several ewes to his bed.
In a voice a bit unctious,
Tom said, "I'm rambunctious,
And the Woolite has gone to my head."

limerick_list.author: Beverley Sharp
limerick_list.text:
There's a book 'bout an angler compleat.
Though that spelling seems rather effete,
Orthographics be axed!
If the rules were relaxed,
It wood ackshully bee purdy neet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He was brassbound (so brash, quite a pest)
When he said I was brassbound, in jest
(Meaning "rigid," or "wed
To the past"). I had said
I love Grandfather's brassbound old chest.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
My wife bought a tiny new car.
Its compactedness seems quite bizarre—
Getting in's a tight fit;
On the gas tank you sit.
It's like jamming your ass in a jar.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE and timon
limerick_list.text:
Definition has this definition:
Explanation of words — that's its mission —
Stating meanings, like scrubbing
Means "cleaning by rubbing".
For more definition I'm fishin'!

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
So why have I stopped seeing Fred?
Have you noticed those scars on his head?
All those craniofacial
Wounds stem from a racial
Expression. Believe me, he bled!

limerick_list.author: Lawrence A. Herman
limerick_list.text:
From the French for old rule, Ancien
Regime now refers to the men
Leading France under Louis,
Who let things get screwy,
And now it's not like it was then.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
In Kenya, most all the Masai know
One aspect about the white rhino:
Notwithstanding its skin
And the skin of its kin,
The white rhino is not an albino.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
My suggestion for translating datively
For folks who don't speak English natively?
Practice linguistic thrift—
Simply say: "as a gift",
Lest you obfuscate meaning creatively.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Though last evening, we bade you adieu,
We bid pleasant good morrow to you.
Guess you lingered, but where?
And whose bed did you share?
On your way, boy; your welcome is through!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Saw this signage: Cheap Haylage For Sale.
What is that? Does it come in a bale?
It's a mixture of hay
(That's been dried, by the way)
And damp silage that shouldn't turn stale.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Of my dreams," he thought, "splendor is born,"
As the five stepped on stage on that morn:
Fulfilling his mission —
A grand composition
For flute, three kazoos, and a horn.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
In the African country of Chad,
Rebels claim that the president's bad.
He's mismanaged the dough
That he promised would go
To the Chadian people.  The cad.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I didn't feel right in the head,
So I took to a hospital bed
Where I slept over days
In a sedative haze;
With this dauerschlaf, demons got shed.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A white wine that a French sommelier
Might suggest for before your entrée
With cassis, as a kir,
Or alone, dry and clear,
Is a Burgundy, Aligoté.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I beseeched the town's baker, Fra Hoaf,
For a calid crucigerous loaf.
When he looked at me blankly,
I said to him, frankly,
"It means hot cross bun, you big oaf!"

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
The countryside's not so concerned
With fashion or power.  They've learned
Through their work and their crops
That their families are tops.
It's a grounding that's not to be spurned.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
I'd been searching for bargains in Beares
Without finding a trace of such wares.
Then I saw in their basement
This sign of displacement:
"Bargain Basement on Fourth Floor Upstairs".

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
I've derived from the concrete noun, bean,
A new abstract noun, bean-ness, to mean
What makes beans "beans" as such,
Be it taste, smell or touch.
(Try with pea — but watch out, keep it clean!)

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Your immune system tries to rebuff
Peanuts, cheese, pollen, pork ... Harmless stuff
To the rest of us maxes
In anaphylaxis
For you. You're allergic. It's rough.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Those roaches prefer now to dwell
In this trap full of poisonous gel!
They just shrug off the drug,
Snug as bugs in a rug,
Or some insect apartment hotel.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Dr. Livingston, do I presume?
Or is that far too much to assume?
Henry Stanley's the name,
Finding you is my game —
So I'm glad I don't have to exhume.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
If not for Fritz Haber's fixation
On feeding the world's population,
He wouldn't have found
How N2 could be bound.
He deserved his Nobel acclamation.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
We're old friends, sporting T-shirts. We came
For a coffee klatch. Let me proclaim
That we don't need a reason —
It's always the season
For get-togethers. Um, what's your name?

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
The scripture of Mormons, so deep,
Boasts a language of biblical sweep.
I tried reading the book
That's called Ether.  It took
Almost no time to put me to sleep.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
To the Scotsman, it means "a wee bit,"
A small (but indefinite) whit.
That's what bittock means—smut
With one letter changed, but
It's, at bottom, completely legit.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
First one hand goes 'cl' and then — zap!
Its partner moves in with an 'ap'.
As the two hands collide,
They bounce back, then decide
To repeat their collision: clap, clap.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Becky's tower has nary a stair,
Yet she lives on the seventh floor there.
The entrance might strike
One as fairytalelike:
With no doors, you must climb up her hair.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
See a church that is simply called Wies,
In baroque style, a masterly piece.
Königsschlösser a must?
It's too crowded, dear—trust:
There's no need for a further increase.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Though the NFL strikers were mocking,
The thespian stand-ins came knocking.
You could tell from the start
When a play fell apart,
They would blame its demise on bad blocking.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
One-eyed Moses, an old Ethiopian,
Thought his life and the world were Utopian,
Yet he'd howl when he would
Not be well understood
When he spoke of himself as cyclopean.

limerick_list.author: LoudNotes
limerick_list.text:
To five carbons conjoined end to end,
Each H forms an angular bend.
Ten and one in amount,
They make compounds we count
As the parts of the paraffin trend.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Only people or dogs, but not beavers
Get sick with canicola fevers.
This dire diagnosis
Of leptospirosis
Makes atheists into believers.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
The dimensions of space-time are four.
There may be, it is said, seven more.
What's a pain to explain
To the brain is a brane
That deforms in ways we can't explore.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"Do not ride on a coach that's a bus,"
Said our coach (our instructor) to us.
"But I will not disparage
A coach (railway carriage).
My motto's 'more training; less fuss'."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Fervent minds like mine live to pursue
Obscure facts known to only a few —
Esoterical knowledge
Not offered in college.
I wanted it, so I withdrew.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
My maths teacher grinningly said,
"You are painfully wrong again, Fred!"
Smiling, said, "Me and you:
One plus one will make two,
And not three! Get this into your head!"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
See them hang by the thousands. This sight
In the caverns can give one a fright.
They are bats from Brazil
And produce quite a thrill,
When en masse they ascend every night.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Like the seldom-seen creature of fable,
The centaur is ready and able
To gallop past Zeus's
Great gravity-nooses,
And seldom approaches the stable.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Rods and reels make him feel so elated
That this angler can never be sated.
Out of lures, worms and flies,
Nonetheless, Tom still tries
To continue to fish unabated.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
For these sufferers, time's the best cure.
They are moody; their memories are poor.
They are just menopausal—
This one simple cause'll
Get wives hot and bothered, for sure.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I think that congealment is icky,
When gravy gels up and gets sticky.
Nuking leftover meat
Or potatoes to eat
Can work out really neat; gravy's tricky!

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
When "A View to a Kill" hit the top
Of the singles charts labelled as Pop,
'Twas the only Bond theme
To have reached that extreme.
It was clearly the cream of the crop.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Contagiously spread among folks
Are the laughs at tonight's comic's jokes.
That's not all that gets spread;
There's a cold in his head.
A hoarse audience member now croaks.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
When I measure magnetic flux density,
I have an old-fashioned propensity
For the CGS unit.
No need to impugn it:
Use gauss for a B-field's intensity!

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Though they caught him, that sponger, my ex,
Stealing cream, jelly, fruit, chocolate flecks
And some sherry he'd mustered, he
Still escaped custardy:
De minimis non curat lex.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
When I die and my body's a clump
Of decaying flesh, fetid and plump,
Place me just how I ask it:
Face down in my casket —
Tell the twits they can all kiss my rump.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
You required of me total immersion
In the tale of your recent conversion
And ambitions monastic.
Yes, thanks, that's fantastic.
(I hope you'll become a Cistercian.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Since our jobs demand total immersion,
We took leave for a circus excursion.
Through the car park we scooted
But by clowns were rerouted.
It was quite an amusing diversion.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Museum-bound trips disinhibit
Lots of kids, till they see the exhibit
Of old punishments: stocks,
Executioners' blocks,
Racks, and  thumb-screws—oh, yes—and the gibbet.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Cook him wieners galore, let 'er rip.
He'll eat lots all at once; he's a trip!
I've seen him, you know,
Eating twelve at one go
(Or as others might say, "at a clip").

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Doing battle, you mount a campaign,
Where you seek to defend and maintain
What you claim is your right.
If you lose, noble knight,
Then you're flushing it down the darraign.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"A cold one," I asked of my ex.
My request wasn't meant to perplex.
I just wanted a beer.
She said, "Angela here
Might suffice. She hates all forms of sex."

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
As a sculptor in metal and plastic,
I just love what all shapes anticlastic
(A potato chip, say,
Or a saddle) convey,
Curving opposite ways.  It's fantastic!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"They support Aston Villa. And you?"
"Yes, my football strip's claret and blue.
The shirt, socks and shorts
Show I'm one who supports
Them. My copy-cat kit is a clue."

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
My friend's acuphagia grew
As each day he ate sabers anew.
All aghast, we watched painfully
As his mentor disdainfully
Told him to swallow, not chew.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You like tunes in your car?  Then equip
It with gear that is modern and hip.
Play cassettes or CDs,
But avoid all LPs.
When your car hits a bump, they will skip.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
She is bullnecked and cross-eyed and shy,
And she belches and smells like a guy.
Yes, her neck's like a log,
And she eats like a hog,
But I love my sweet Lola, oh my!

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Abadie's, if you please, is a sign
With a message that's less than divine:
If the eyelids should twitch,
Hyperthyroid's the hitch;
If the tendons are numb, check the spine.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
I escape in the quiet of night
On a fabulous fairytale flight
To a fantasy dreamscape,
A peaches-and-cream-scape,
And dwell there till morning's first light.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
In the playoffs, the fielder named Mudd,
Who played center, connected—a "Thud!"
It was chased down by Fletcher,
Who threw to the catcher,
But by then into home Mudd had slud.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
You're spineless — a creep and a flirt!
Keep your filthy hands out of my shirt!
Don't give me that frown,
You amyelous clown —
Even breaking your neck wouldn't hurt!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
The king of the jungle has stores
Of deafening strength during wars.
When wounded, it's proud
To be royally loud—
They say when it pains that it roars.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
We have gotten a general fix
On the aircraft. It's North 26,
West 100 degrees,
On its way to Belize.
Four more hours, the pilot predicts.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
There are things so intrinsically linked,
You might think they're the same if you blinked —
But not skunks mixed with skinks,
Because one of them stinks,
And it's something that makes them distinct.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
Any affable fellow like Bill
Is so kind, he'll inspire goodwill.
 But an off-able guy
 Might be fated to die,
Since he's someone who's easy to kill.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
That pickpocket "Deftly" was one
With a name that meant "dextrously done."
He could pick pockets bare
With incredible flair,
Then be gone ere one knew he'd begun.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Want to color some cloth? You should try
(If it's animal-based) acid dye.
It's synthetic? A nylon?
You'll still keep your smile on,
But rayon? You'll fail and might cry.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Antiatoms are strange and absurd,
But exist, it is widely averred.
Antiparticles are
Their true essence and star
In an opposite world, so I've heard.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My deuce coupe is a '32 car;
For us racers it sets a high bar.
I remain unamused
When that term is confused
With doux scoops of French mousse. Har-dee-har.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Ten techniques you can learn really quick!
Breathless headlines like that make you click
On junk stories, increasing
Web page views. Unceasing,
Such clickbait's a time-sucking trick.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
So you didn't consult, not at all?
"I'm PM, so that's that. Captain's call.
With this sword I thee dub —
Rise, Sir Phil." There's the rub:
On thy sword, mate, thou shortly wilt fall.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
What's that horrible ruckus I hear?
A Three Stooges guy's coming, I fear.
From that loud "Nyuk! Nyuk! Nyuk!"
I  can tell that old knuck-
lehead Curly is soitenly near.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
My daughter has quite a nice dimple
On the opposite side to her pimple.
(It's a hollow that's in
Your cheek when you grin.)
It goes really well with her wimple!

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Have you heard the school's new concert band?
The percussion's especially grand.
The brass section's neat,
And the woodwinds are sweet.
It's the grandest school band in the land!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Some spiders will try to entrance,
Even charm the antennae off ants.
It's a serious case
That arachnids can face
When they lust for acerous romance.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
When chancing the waters of Venice,
Avoid gondoliers such as Denis:
He's managed to fondle a
Few in his gondola:
His fancy canal boat's a menace.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
An author of recondite lit
Anaphorically wrote down an "it."
What this "it" must refer to
May someday occur to
A reader of genuine grit.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You would never mistake them for cubes—
Epididymides: efferent tubes
That transport your sperms,
And can feel like coiled worms,
In your scrotum—down there near your pubes.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
For her dip-solder deftness all laud her.
For great circuit board dipping applaud her:
Watch her mask, flux and dip
In a heartbeat, then drip —
Yes, my daughter's The Diva of Solder!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
While the road to the White House is long,
You must first please the Iowa throng.
Most supporters today
Of one candidate say:
"What the Hillary doing that's wrong?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our cause for divorce? Not complex.
Seems that Tex had a mind to desex
My companion, dear Daniel,
A young cocker spaniel.
Once husband, now Tex is my ex.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Cool and clumsy,  and round as a quail,
God's experiment: fated to fail!
Might this large, passive meal
Have dodged slaughter? Get real!
Dopy dodos would never prevail.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Digladiation means "fighting with swords"
(Or it did, ancient history records).
It's "a brawl," in addition,
Though this definition
Has also since gone by the boards.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Spring has sprung, and the meadow is green.
Behold now this pastoral scene—
To the ewe'd said the ram,
"Wham and bam! Thankee, ma'am."
Big with lamb, she's now ready to ean.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said a cross-dressing actor named Scottie,
"I've a body that covers my body.
Camiknickers are what
Mom and Dad called them, but
That term's out with today's glitterati."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Any-interest-date term of redemption
Gives the issuer right of preemption
On the scheme to repay:
For on each coupon day
He can pay off the loan — no exemption.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Senate and House went ahead
With a bill, which the president said
He would veto, and just
As he vowed, it went bust—
On arrival, the measure was dead.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Gearhart
limerick_list.text:
There's a protein that's formed as blood's clottin'
Called fibrin.  It's one that's well-gotten,
But when plasma that's tested
Shows fibrin's divested
Pathologically, that's just plain rotten!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
More than one South American monkey
In this family's known to be spunky,
But calling them wicked's
Unfair. Callitrichids
Are cute, though their odors are funky.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A cerastes, the venomous viper,
Is moving in tune with a piper.
Each is horned, so to speak,
Though the piper's unique,
Looking chic in a Gandhian diaper.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
An apostrophe?!  Jeez!  Shoulda known
Not to etch that.  The epitaph shown
Is so wrong in its flagrance.
PICK A ROSE AND IT'S FRAGRANCE
REMAINS is, alas, carved in stone.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We've entered the New Transatlantic
Hunting Dog Show.  First prize is gigantic!
To prepare, we've worked feverishly—
And Golden Retriever-ishly—
So my husband and dog are both frantic.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
