Why won't somebody drop me a line?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The madman had set out to scare us all
With his threat: he intended to tear us all
Into bits Lilliputian,
Then, mixed in solution,
He would spray us on walls via aerosol.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Education for fish might be sappy,
But schooling makes sunfish so happy.
Those considered the smartest,
Who study the hardest,
Might make it to Phi Beta Crappie.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Take effierce," said the synonym king,
"And one more with a similar ring:
It's enfierce with an 'n'.
'To make fierce,' they mean. Then,
What's the difference, you ask? Not a thing."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
After fueling my car (that's a fill-up),
The attendant did not bring my bill up.
I yelled, "What's the delay?
I'm real busy today!"
He said, "Cool it — I'm fixing the till up!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
You might think that this region of Spain
Would be lacking in cats in the main.
I once dreamed it was known
For just one cat alone:
Catalonia—mouse-free terrain!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Some confectioners tried to make hay
From iconic Yank names, and so they
Produced Lindy, Ross, Red—
But they found that, instead,
For those candy bars, no one would pay.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Lighten up, Hon, you look broken-hearted.
You've glimpsed his first sketch—he's just started.
That's a basic esquisse;
Give the artist some peace.
That expression! Like someone's just farted.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
There's a glycerol diphosphatidyl
Called cardiolipin; it's vital
In the Wassermann test
For that syphilis pest,
While the syphilis still lounges idle.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
What a do-nothing kid we have raised.
On all of our goodies he's grazed.
He  plays games with his buddy —
Won't work; doesn't study,
But gets As in the ways he has lazed!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When an oracle's organs auricular
Both project from his head perpendicular,
His predictions oracular
Become more spectacular.
But accurate? Not in particular.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm doomed, friend, to fry in the chair.
Please take charge of the grisly affair.
You are so executorial;
Write my memorial,
Cry, throw the switch, say a prayer.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
There's a storm brewing up in the sea
As it roughens and threatens the quay
With its seething and churning,
Retreating, returning,
And stirring up foam with esprit.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Cynocephalus—man with the head
Of a dog on his body, it's said.
No case for zoology,
But traced from mythology,
Like Anubis, the god of the dead.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Your gallantry, sir, has no bound;
Though that courtliness stuff, I have found,
In seducers like you
Has a good deal to do
With the fact I've young daughters around.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a stud, he was judged "not so hot."
Of the basics, he didn't know squat.
He had lousy technique
And his foreplay was weak.
"A for effort" was all that he got.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
From certain celebs, my fixation
Derives.  I've a preoccupation.
When the camera light's out,
I try learning about
What they do.  Is this idolization?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I defined for my medical final
The adjective corticospinal:
To the spine it pertains
And the cortex (the brain's)—
Not the nose, 'cause that goes under rhinal.
limerick_list.question: To what does the corticospinal pertain?

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Remote diagnosis?  I'm cynical.
Though medicine's reached quite a pinnacle,
Perhaps quackery will
Send our healthcare downhill
On an anticline most anticlinical.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The study of fossilized feces
Discloses the habits of species
Of creatures extinct—
Coprolitically linked
By their food, claim zoologists' theses.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Devil's grip hits your chest like a rock
So each breath hurts like hell. What a shock.
Epidemic pleural-
gia's so hard on morale,
It's  the grasp of the phantom. [CUE BACH.]

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"With apt stratagems dearly required,
An aerial transfer's transpired!
The ellipsoid now lands
In the accipient's hands."
"As a football announcer, YOU'RE FIRED!"

limerick_list.author: Beverley Sharp
limerick_list.text:
I've one eye.  I look rather Cyclopic,
And I tend to be slightly myopic.
Editorials, too,
Have but one point of view—
But the damnable print's microscopic!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Taking steroids, young man? Well, that's doping
To improve your performance. You're hoping
To be stronger and faster,
But risking disaster—
If caught, you'll have reason for moping.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Fade in: the scene slowly appears,
As the sounds of doom swell in your ears.
The director expects
That his chosen effects
Will all subtly add to your fears.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
All this hand-kissing business is swell,
But I'm sure not some fair damozel.
Why use fine courtly airs
On a maid below stairs?
There's no soap kills that oniony smell.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
These distinctions of place get no blunter:
When Northumbrians say, "There's a dunter,"
It's a porpoise; meanwhile,
The Orcadians smile
At an eider duck, ripe for the hunter.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The fire department says, "Please
Be aware we have great expertise
In all manner of ways
To save lives nowadays.
We do not just get cats out of trees."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Obscure terms?  Yes, I know quite a few,
And I'm happy to share them with you.
While to some it's a bore,
I'm celebrious for
Using large words where small ones will do.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The handfast and swipple aren't frail:
They're two major parts of a flail.
Leather caps (those are caplings)
And straps (those are taplings)
Join them up. But beware a flail's fail.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Daily exercise: schoolwards I race.
My satchel, held tightly in place,
Holds cards, sweets and toys,
And some comics for boys,
But not exercise books (there's no space).

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
The zombies are trying to clutch us—
Run fast so they can't grab or touch us!
We must race to save face
And avoid their embrace!
If we're caught, there would not be as much us.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Said the wolf, "This old shepherd will keep
Me at bay and I so want a sheep.
Chloral hydrate, I need,
To pursue my dark deed.
A few drops in his drink and he'll sleep."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
All the men in my life—each a miner—
Pull coal from the ground—not one whiner.
But when church bells start ringing,
We cokers start clinging,
Awaiting bad news at the diner.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
In the band room, the scene left us glum —
There some vandal had smashed every drum.
When the maestro, enraged,
Checked the damage he gauged,
"You will see repercussions to come!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Since it's not often worn as before,
The derby is hard to ignore:
Just a simple black hat,
Round on top and that's that—
The sort Laurel and Hardy both wore.

limerick_list.author: Doug Harris and Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Averse: if not one word but two,
Has dissimilar sense, you'll construe.
All one's "disinclined"
While two's "rhyme refined".
I loathe the confusion, don't you?

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
F: the stock market symbol for Ford.
FA: football's main governing board.
Fat: it's something to chew.
Fate: an outcome for you.
Fates: three goddesses choose man's reward.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Coincidence?  Woman and man?
Accidentally's how we began?
Whereas you take the stance
We arose quite by chance,
I believe we were part of God's plan.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"America, land of the free,
Is the best of the best! Vote for me!"
Any flag waver may
Attract votes, but I say
That one's stand on the issues is key.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is hard to rejoice and make merry
On a diet of buffaloberry.
Though the berries are edible,
Their taste is incredible.
Are they bitter, you ask? I'd say very!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The mellowest fellow I've met,
Having swallowed a rat on a bet,
Had allowed, as he died
From the chomping inside,
That it might have been something he et.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The orator moved one and all
As his baritone voice filled the hall.
By the end of the night
We were ready to fight
In response to his clarion call.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
"Our financial fragility's bleak;
We've got creditors calling each week.
Part-time work's not enough,
The sedan's running rough..."
"Someone's knocking. Walk softly. Don't speak!"

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
My feminineness (femininity)
Is known in our local vicinity.
I'm wearing high heels,
And a mantle conceals
My womb with its yet unborn trinity.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm cosmetically challenged—a guy
Who's perplexed by the stuff women buy.
What are toners, concealers,
And chemical peelers?
Is blush for the cheek or the eye?

limerick_list.author: Nan
limerick_list.text:
I get nervous when naming f-fleas.
	It's not easy; it's hard as b-bees.
	Or worse still's that b-bug,
	The bean weevil—oh, ugh:
A-c-can-tho-thoscel-li-lides.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"He is almost a general," said Ruth,
"And he finds the enlisted uncouth.
Drunken sergeants, he's said,
Are too often ill bred."
(And in that there's a colonel of truth.)

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The broadcasting schedule was filled,
So they ordered my program be killed.
A cablecast, though,
Might deliver my show;
If they sign it, my fans will be thrilled.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
They're arraigning an angel in heaven
Who's charged with purloining the leaven.
(This arraigning has airs
With its five letter-pairs—
Scintillescent is said to have seven.)

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A student who wasn't astute
Was instructed to find a square root.
When he dug up the ground,
Every root that he found
Turned up roundish—and branchy, to boot.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
I've put vitamin pills in this jar,
Some water, some rocks, and some tar.
  Now I stir with a knife
  Till it blooms with new life
And autogeny makes me a star!

limerick_list.author: LoudNotes
limerick_list.text:
Portuguese (now Chinese) port Macau,
Doesn't use China's unit, the jiao.
In this land near Malacca,
A yuan's a pataca,
And the cents are called avos, I'll vow.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
I applied for a travel award
For the cost, which I couldn't afford,
Of pursuing my sweetie,
Who'd left for Tahiti:
I just want to study a broad.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
A baby stays put where it's laid,
Like a wee sack of sand, oh, so staid.
But a 'terrible two'
Can run faster than you,
Or hide out in a quick ambuscade.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
A painter of art, quite the nerd,
Loved to use the odd obsolete word.
So "to paint" was depaint.
And then, even more quaint,
He would spell it depeinct. How absurd.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My gardening friend, Anastasia,
Knows all about herbs like Euphrasia,
Used for treating the eyes.
Her book's called (no surprise!)
Healing Herb-Growing: Don't Let It Faze Ya.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A small northern fish like the cod,
The capelin's a creature of God.
And the source of his name
Is exactly the same
As a chaplain's. Now isn't that odd?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Hydrocarbons like camphene are used
In insecticides, sending enthused
Fans of hiking and camping
Out merrily tramping
Through woods without getting abused.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I have cravings for gherkins, ice cream,
Macadamia nuts, and I seem
To have never enough.
I must be up the duff!
How I retch with this wretched regime.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Since Shirley's my name, and I'm dressed
All in white you have probably guessed
It's a wedding.  And so,
Getting hitched to my Beau
Means you'll holler out, "Shirley, you Geste!"

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A man showing few signs of life
Declined to go under the knife:
"I'd rather fuss less—
My cadaverousness
Is all that arouses my wife."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Étienne is not active politically;
His oeuvre explores analytically
The accented é
In thé and café.
He will likely, I'd say, die acritically.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
I'm so glad that you're proud to be gay,
This is truly a red-letter day.
You've come out of the closet—
Not so difficult, was it?
(Now it's clear, I can put things away.)

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Unexpected: my dish won first prize!
It was judged to be best in the eyes
Of the victims who tasted
What I carefully basted:
Three turkey-and-strawberry pies.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
My aquarium's cichlids would hide,
Or if not, they would flee till they died.
But with dither fish there,
Timid cichlids would dare
To come out, and their fear would subside.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Her erratical takes? Disconcerting.
She often would laugh at my flirting,
But sometimes act sad,
And might even get mad;
Her moods were forever inverting.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Simple alkanes and alkenes are strings
Of carbons — plain linear things.
An "-ene" is no trouble:
One bond is a double,
And alkyne a triple bond brings.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Guacamole dip? None of it's left.
And of bridge mix the sideboard's bereft.
So you'll have to admit
The whole snack spread's a hit.
Tonight's poker, though, sure felt like theft.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
Holy Christopher carried Our Lord
Through the river the child couldn't ford.
He calmed travelers' fears,
Only now it appears
He's mere legend and shan't be adored.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We are crocodiles. Each of us tries
To eat all that Mom Nature supplies,
But whenever we dine,
Our demeanor's just fine.
We stay dry, with no tears in our eyes.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
"You were sprawled on your lawn in a daze.
Came some cows that your fence didn't faze.
They mistook you for grass,
And they chewed on your ass!"
"No sweat, dude. It's only a graze."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
"If you all, congregation and choir,
Want a phrase that can mean 'the attire
Of ordained personnel'
And 'the clergy,'  as well,
The cloth covers both," said the friar.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Antihuman? How could you—you beast!
Please consider our good points, at least.
We're industrious, smart,
And we've made some nice art—
You would miss us if we were deceased.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Puritanical is the mentality
Of some; alas, that's the reality.
So show me a sign
Of what crosses the line
When I write about sex, or carnality.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Evasive, corrupt, and a liar,
That candidate swims in the mire
Of scandal.  Reject
Her deceit.  Don't elect
One who's crooked; our straits will be dire.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
You have plague, and a worm (parasitic),
Dropsy too, and your knees are arthritic.
Your ill humours converge,
And I urge you to purge—
This prescription is for an eccritic.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
When one galaxy's path intersects
With another's, the bigger collects
Many stars. Sometimes all
Of the smaller will fall
To galactic cannibalism's effects.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
She centers her life on her son.
He's her focus, her favorite—the one
She attends to and favors.
I bet that this shaver's
A self-centered kid when she's done.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
Bentham's principle resonates still—
Act to make the world's happy cups fill:
 Bring more pleasure to man.
 This utility plan,
Much like grist, was refined by the Mill.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My breasts are like mushrooms that swell
Overnight by the creek in the dell.
My bra size is tearing
Through letters: I'm wearing
A cup that's less K and more L.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
There's rage in each well-chosen word;
Every syllable sings to the herd.
She's fomenting rebellion
And bedlam, that hellion.
Can't ignore her—the bitch will be heard.

limerick_list.author: Kim Le
limerick_list.text:
In a club in the forties he sat—
Of those swingers, the funkiest cat.
He would play bebop jazz,
Soulful, rhythmic pizzazz.
Man, that bebopper never played flat.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An adversary process, perforce,
Has opponents at odds, like divorce.
I've an ex that I dread
'Cause she left in my bed
A reminder—the head of a horse.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
My godparents vowed to attend
To my spiritual health, so they send
Me to church every day
And demand that I pray.
Yet, to hell I'll get sent in the end!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
As an infant all squalling and wee,
I was baptized. Meant nothing to me.
When I knew what I swore
I was baptized once more.
I was then born again, praises be!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
DNA in your chromosomes dwells,
In the nuclei, deep in your cells.
Have you Papa's blue eyes?
Your great-grandmother's thighs?
Cheeks that swell? Well, it's breeding that tells.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
It helps how your muscles will feel,
But use caution: the danger is real.
Rub aconite on
And your pains may be gone—
But don't eat it, or that's your last meal.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A theory that's now obsolete
Called caloric the substance of heat.
Cold was fluid, "frigoric,"
Devoid of caloric.
Not germane to the junk food we eat.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An archbishopric: this is the base
That the archbishop's powers embrace.
Each monsignor and priest,
From the highest to least,
Is respected (if not in disgrace).

limerick_list.author: psheil
otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
A man who walked into a bar
Was then stuck there—he couldn't get far.
His magnetic attraction
Induced his inaction—
As bar magnets go, he's a star.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I fell and I bruised my behind
On the street, a young stranger was kind.
Thus through sheer accidentalness,
I discovered her gentleness;
Now I can't get her out of my mind.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
By a star, the three wise men were led.
But they found, as they stood at His bed,
That the one brightest light
On that first Christmas night
Was the glow from the Son of God's head.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Hell Down Under, Act One.  At my desk,
I am penning a play Dante-esque —
Bazza: "Lock up your daughters,
Prepare for mass slaughters.
The wombats have all gone beresk!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When we started discussing the deal,
He offered a bankerly spiel,
Saying interest, compounded,
Would leave me astounded.
I asked myself, "Is he for real?"

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
Since all manner of funds have receded,
My life is severely impeded.
Though I don't like to stress
Over spending much less,
This economisation is needed.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Our software's new buttons are slick,
But learning to use them's a trick.
We're all in concordance:
They need an affordance
So users can tell where to click.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The length of the summer vacation,
When a child, seemed so long. Now vexation,
Both as mother and teacher,
Means she's missing this feature:
Time off is too short in duration.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
Though Chuck Barris, producer of games,
Broadcast Newlywed, Dating (their names),
We have thought, all along,
His most famous was Gong,
Where acts suffered through panelists' flames.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
With this ink, all the marks you have made
Will not yellow, and never will fade.
Though its brown is just soot,
Bister stays where it's put.
As a wash, you can alter your shade.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
You'd refuse their bestowal? A pity
Just to leave it outside of the city.
Are they really such sneaks,
All these gift-bearing Greeks?
(Though a Greek-bearing gift seems so witty!)

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
When the challenge demands urgent action,
But it's tougher than teak to gain traction,
Buckle to; strain the sinew;
Give all that is in you,
And your sweat will yield sweet satisfaction.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
ABC represents a Chinese
Who's American-born—ill at ease
Between cultures that clash,
Putting soy sauce on hash,
Using chopsticks for picking up peas.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
If you hear a strange chime, like a gong,
In some wood where no bell should belong,
That mysterious sound
(Which can echo around)
Is the bell-bird's reverberant song.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
When my aunt irked the secret police,
The Gestapo, her mission did cease.
They quenched opposition,
And German sedition
Was seen as a threat to their "peace".

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Women's catalogs come in the mail.
All the models look thin, if not frail,
And the cami-clad lasses
Never seem to wear glasses.
If they did, few would note that detail.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
The strange people and places of Alice
In Wonderland (Was there a palace?)
Make us smile and feel good,
As such silliness should,
And, in turn, just a little less callous.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's that flying above, in between
The high branches? A green Philippine
Parrot's kept us enthralled.
Seems a cagit it's called,
But to cage it would really be mean.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I was self-assured, did what I chose,
Lost my will, and now anything goes.
But my qualms shouldn't fool ya —
It's only dysbulia.
That's serious enough, I suppose.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Buccaneerish, he walks on a peg:
He'd mistaken a black powder keg
For a barrel of grog
In the midst of a fog.
Now he's using a log as a leg.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
They come on the wind once again
And fall now and then with the rain.
Atmogenic examples
Include many samples
From mountains that cough their terrain.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
All her co-workers grinned at Sue Black,
And she thought we were eyeing her rack.
With no dryer sheets used,
We were merely amused
By the fuzzy pink sock on her back.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
One might hear us kalutas debating
The relative merits of "dating."
I've heard rumors it's great,
But I know it's our fate
That we males all die soon after mating.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Up and down go the pistons, I found,
And the crankshaft, it goes round and round.
But the cylinder block,
Just as solid as  rock,
Holds the pistons in place, safe and sound!

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
"I'll be damned!" cried the Prez from his seat
Upon spilling his flavored ice treat.
Used a vacuum remover
We called "sherbert Hoover";
A pun that's this bad's hard to beat.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Said the Prez, "Our economy's trending
To recession.  We see it descending.
So my stimulus pitch
To get out of this ditch?
Let's engage in some deficit spending."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Chenopodium's oft overlooked.
This "fat hen" has some value when cooked.
Nip the annual weed
Ere it runs into seed.
Enjoy spinach? This might get you hooked.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
In our workshop, my clumsy friend Jay
Was polishing metal one day
When I heard him start swearing—
The brush wheel was tearing
The pants he was wearing away!

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
He loves showing off his bicepses,
But I view this display with some scepsis:
No-one's seen him (to date)
Lift a heavier weight
Than a Big Mac and chips and two Pepsis.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
If traditional banks will not help you
In that scheme for a team to farm kelp, you
Can use crowdfunding sites
To raise cash to new heights—
Default and the punters can't skelp you!

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
If you seek legal nullification,
But you don't like the word abrogation,
Here's an optional deal:
When you file your appeal
You might ask for, instead, a cassation.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
I'm stuck with a habit quite funny.
I chat with my friendly pet bunny.
My wife in dismay,
As we rabbit away,
Says, "That's anthropomorphism, honey".

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A burglar in Rome filled his bag
With a surfeit of silvery swag.
"All the aurum's a bore,
But I simply adore
The argentum (in shorter form, Ag)."

limerick_list.author: WordWeaver
limerick_list.text:
Is your kid not your kid?  Well, I'd guess
He's a changeling.  Now fairies possess
The real tyke that you loved
While in his place they've shoved
This deformed, ugly, dim-witted mess.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
In a pre-Celtic burial mound
An old earth spirit lived underground.
The new civilised race
On the planet's changed face
Had too hectic a pace, he had found.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Epipodiale," I moan.
It's a radius, ulna, or bone
In the shank. But, you see,
With no terminal e,
It's in molluscs or plants, softly grown.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Things for Dan are, no doubt, breaking well,
Though he hasn't scrubbed up for a spell.
He's a hobo, and yet
He has just met Yvette
Who is rich, thinks he's great, and can't smell.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Pa liked gnawing on chaw, although "Gah!
All that chewing is crude, Pa!" cawed Ma.
"The brown drool down your chin
Is a source of chagrin —
It is gross and a grievous faux pas!"

limerick_list.author: buttonbright
limerick_list.text:
A lawyer, both savvy and cynical,
Produced a last-minute adminicle —
New proof to support
What he'd said to the court
(Just so long as they didn't get clinical).

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
A monk who is Turkish or Persian,
Who's embraced "pauper lifestyle immersion",
Should not make you nervous.
What he's called is a Dervis,
Or Dervise (an alternate version).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A bandster was clearly the guy
Who bound wheat sheaves at harvest. That's why
If you played clarinet,
It's a pretty safe bet
This is one job you'd want to pass by.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The astrolabe, wondrous old tool,
Was a star-checking, technical jewel.
But it's no longer extant;
We now have the sextant.
That's something they taught me in school.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
They are comparably clad—each a sweater
With a sparkling new varsity letter—
But watching them run,
You'll be certain that one
Of the twins is incomparably better.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I applied for a job as reporter,
Not ads-for-department-stores sorter.
To scout stories I'd meant,
But I'm desk-bound—I'm pent—
So I'll leave at the end of this quarter.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The blue ice that shattered our ceiling
Left a hole, stains and stench — we're still reeling.
Local press got the scoop:
"Airline leaks frozen poop,
But won't pay so the family's appealing."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
There's a desolateness to my yard.
It looms empty except for the guard
Who's told kids, one and all,
Not to come get their ball
'Cause the neighborhood brats are all barred.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dyer's woodruff may cause some disputes
As I seek a red dye for my boots.
A rival of madder,
It's high on the ladder
Of natural dyes. Use its roots.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
When the test kit was offered, I bit,
And submitted a tube of my spit.
DNA gave a clue:
I've got half-sibs.  Who knew?
I'm just gobsmacked—ne'er soothsayed a hit!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Off to bed in the winter we go,
But our shutters are broken, and so
Winds blow in, and they spread
O'er our covers in bed
Frosty blanketlike layers of snow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"There's a man in my cell!" cried the nun.
"In my bedroom he's looking for fun,
But I've taken a vow
And I won't change it now,
So I'm fixin' to get up and run!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"What's the matter, then?  You can tell me,"
He enquired, avuncularly.
"Is it girlfriends' demands?
'Uncle Stan' understands."
Then I felt his right hand on my knee...

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My college just built a new dorm.
Seems it's cubo-octahedral in form,
Like a cube that's been cut
At each corner, somewhat.
Dean McNutt said, "That shape's the new norm!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A procedure performed on the eyes,
Should restriction of movement arise,
Is the forced duction test,
Where results are assessed
In what Cockneys might call 'yer mince pies'.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
You teed off for a round at the club,
Then nipped out for a round at the pub,
But showed little remorse.
Now you're banned from our course.
You have acted delinquently, bub.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Just do it!" is so fitspirational.
"Sweat more and bitch less" — motivational!
I love "Let go of doubt".
Slogans beat workin' out!
(Can't work out why my flab's so stagnational.)

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
"A most generous person, I swear,"
Said the doc, "you can see over there.
Always kind and good-hearted,
Our dearly departed:
Organ donors like him are quite rare."

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
My stomach's bound up in a knot,
The result of a bungled-up plot.
I need Tums and some Pepto
(Good thing I'm a klepto).
Am I bound for a cold jailhouse cot?

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Clathromorphum live up where it's cold;
These red algae hold secrets untold.
The slow growth of their shells
Tracks the ice on the swells
As the patterns of climate unfold.

limerick_list.author: GAD
limerick_list.text:
I observe, with no slight agitation,
My posterior's loud exclamation!
Seems my dinner of greens,
Served with rice and black beans,
Has resulted in gasification.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I'll fast-forward recordings on-screen,
Through the adverts (no need to be seen),
But I then overshoot,
So I have to reboot;
Can't rewind on this ancient machine.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A drop letter, put in the mail,
In the post office lands without fail.
Then it sits on a shelf;
You retrieve it yourself
(Though you won't have to pay any bail).

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
We're Celosia, yes that is our genus;
We've furry, spiked blooms — have you seen us?
Pink or purplish are we
And quite striking to see!
Yet I hear there are those who demean us.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
He answered with breezy celerity,
To swiftly establish the 'verity'.
Though he'd hidden the gun
Had they seen what he'd done?
His one chance lay in speed and temerity.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A womanly fellow called Clark,
Whose effeminate nature was stark,
Thought of shoes the whole day
In his cabriolet
While attempting to parallel park.

limerick_list.author: David Bourke
limerick_list.text:
Actinometry? My explanation:
The measurement of radiation
(The "incident" sort)
Photochemically caught,
In electro-magnetic migration.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Never stop at a shop for directions
That involve several wye intersections:
"You bear left, then bear right,
Then straight on at the light."
Or vice versa; them's our recollections.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The medical student's last thesis,
On the skin during diaphoresis,
States medicinal oils
Can prevent ugly boils;
Thus can athletes avoid empyesis.

limerick_list.author: Kuranui
limerick_list.text:
When hearing deep-sea orchestration,
There's nothing, in my estimation,
As good as the whale;
Its glorious scale
Truly makes it a singing cetacean.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Radiation that's cosmic pervades
All of space, and its presence persuades
Many folks to infer
The Big Bang did occur,
For without it, the evidence fades.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
F.a.d.i.n.g. f.a.d.
i.n.g. f.a.d.i.n.g.
The print's growing paler;
This lim's looking frailer:
F.a.d.i.n.g... Can you see?

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I think we're all anglophones here,
But with varying skill, 'twould appear —
Some better, some worse,
Some speak it in verse.
For the best, it becomes their career.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
At a uni, in gaysocs, you'll find
Fellow students. Their outlook of mind,
If you're lesbian / gay,
Will be just the same way
As your own. For support they're designed.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
An air lock's where spacemen converse
In that place between bad and what's worse,
When aliens invade
Their plagued ship and hopes fade,
Unless they can mend that [add curse].

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Sarge was shrill, but used soldierly skill
As he put us through close-order drill.
We always were ready
For this march that was steady—
Not thrilling, but run-of-the-mill.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Viagra, so says my adviser,
Is sildenafil, trademarked by Pfizer.
The blue diamonds I'm fed
Mean I'm longer in bed,
Though I'm lately the earliest riser.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A Canadian sailor named Smoot
Found a word that he thought was a hoot.
It meant near or around
Or concerning; he'd found
How to say it, as well: it's about.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
In your little black dress, you look swell,
And I sure love that "No. 5" smell.
Haute couture (that's "high fashion")
Has filled me with passion
For you, thanks to Coco Chanel.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My senator's cool so I wrote him
About Trump: "Sir, we ought to demote him.
He's a bawbag, say I."
(Though I'm not quite sure why
It's an insult to call him a scrotum.)

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
In the groove of a record, a needle.
Into dancing, musicians me wheedle.
My emotions improve
As I get in my groove,
And I groove to the music they tweedle.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a chiru from out in Tibet.
As a mascot, its fame will be set.
China's games in '08
Will make antelopes rate
As Olympics fans' favorite pet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Do you wake up each morning with dread
'Cause you're scratching your torso and head?
Well, my boy, it's a cinch
You've encountered the chinch,
And that bedbugs reside in your bed.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
What's funny for some isn't fun,
When the butt of the joke comes undone.
Some cartoons set aflame
Muslim fury. They blame
Twelve mere pics as if shot from a gun.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
An Asscher cut diamond was not
A stone people purchased a lot.
But stars of today
Wear rings that display
The square emerald cut, so it's hot.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Archimedean solid? We'll make
One by carving this cube — piece of cake!
For a cubo-octahedron,
Fourteen faces we need, Ron;
Cutting corners is what it will take.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Word shortening's a practical wheeze
To make everyday speech flow with ease.
E.g. glamorous — glam:
That describes what I am.
Dazzling; gorgeous and ready to please.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
For that countersunk hole, what you need
Is a screw that is meant to recede.
Get a flat-head screw, Joe;
Its flat top will not show.
It'll work like a charm, guaranteed.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
If aquarium creatures amuse ya,
Why not check out the fish called gambusia?
They're used in this area
To curb both malaria
And mosquitoes that try to transfuse ya.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Bullet-ridden, it seems an old rag,
With hurt stitching that's making it sag.
But it flew proud and strong
At the front of our throng,
Leading us into battle, our flag.

limerick_list.author: WordWeaver
limerick_list.text:
Acarologists harbor a passion
For bugs that are hardly in fashion.
Acaridans' bites
(Those of ticks and of mites)
Keep us itchin' and scratchin' and thrashin'.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Cuckoo smurfing's a scheme whereby crooks
Launder cash. On the surface, it looks
Above board: legit schmo,
Unawares, transmits dough.
Underneath, someone's cooking the books.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
"Absolutely!" I shout and I snap,
As I ready my hand for a slap.
I will not stand for flack,
And insist: "White or black!
I'll have none of your shades-of-gray crap!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I can not get a good grasp on rhyming.
If I said that I did, I'd be lying.
My meter is passable,
But my rhymes are impossible
And sound like so much mashed potatoes.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
To clean muddy boots at the door,
So one doesn't leave tracks on the floor,
Or for scrubbing the wood
Of a deck, we found good
Some rough matting (a bear, heretofore).

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The word firmware sounds strange, and you might
Think its meaning is "clothes that fit tight".
You'd be wrong though my son;
A computer, to run,
Must contain some to make it go right.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In a cyclone, the eye is the center.
It's a place that you don't want to enter.
Though it's calm there, it's true,
That's a move you will rue.
If you live, you will be a repenter.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I love Twitter!  It's sure hard to beat
Getting agitprop out on the street.
My followers follow
Each word.  And they swallow
All lies and half-truths that I tweet.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If your bone structure's actually big,
And each bone isn't thin as a twig,
Then you're big-boned, it's true.
I mean others, not you,
You enormous gargantuan pig!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Just how far is an arm's length away?
If you stretch can you reach it, or nay?
When they claim with a grin
"You're an armshot within,"
Are they pulling your leg, so to say?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Antigravity houses create
In the mind an illusory state —
Water flowing uphill,
Objects clinging at will
To the walls — 'cause these structures aren't straight.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
On my sailboat I felt like a loser,
So I bought me a new cabin cruiser.
Now I live on the seas
And can swamp whom I please;
I've gone from abused to abuser.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was bending my elbow alone
In a bar where I wasn't well known,
When this drunkard named Lyle
Bent my ear for a while:
Two straight hours of "Moan, moan, moan, moan"!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Young Len Bias, a basketball star,
Signed with Boston. They said he'd go far.
Two days later, he's dead—
Too much coke in his head.
Untold billions unearned. How bizarre!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The whole congregation now stands,
And each chorister's belly expands.
O, sing now cantate —
Eighteen after eighty
In Psalms: "Show your joy, all ye lands!"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The route is a certain prediction,
Possessing a palpable striction.
River, traffic, or horse —
Will progress on its course
By prescription, and not by conviction.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The Conservative Party are hoary—
Somewhat stodgy, but more to their glory.
While they may be old hat,
I applaud them for that;
You might say I'm appreciatory.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
I lighted your way to alight
With a lamp that you said was too bright.
You were blinded, no doubt,
But the flame is now out
(Not alight).  You'll recover your sight.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
If you dunt me with blows that confound,
I will dunt very hard to the ground.
But I'll take the affront,
Though my heart will fair dunt
With great anger and sadness unbound.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
ED ads should be tactful and good,
With a message that's clear, understood.
Perhaps borrow a line 
That for milk has worked fine:
Just a simple request like "Got wood?"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"We cannot go on fighting like this —
We must stop it!  Let's make up and kiss!"
"It is kiss first, then make up."
"But let us not break up!"
"And pretend we have marital bliss?"

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
If a symphony job is your mission,
You'd better learn how to audition.
Those try-outs are trying.
Remember, no crying!
Can't hack it? Become a physician.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
With Nobby and Sid on the block,
The crime rate has soared—quite a shock,
Since these nincompoops grab,
Sometimes mug… even stab—
Our policemen work all round the clock.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The elder may not look like much,
But its berries perform in the clutch.
And the elderflowers produce
Some flavorsome juice
Used in cordials and syrups and such.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
All my words tumble out in a rush
And I feel myself starting to blush.
I've gone red as a beet,
For whenever I meet
Someone pretty my brain turns to mush.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That consuming alembic of grief
Stole our dreams like a smoke-shrouded thief.
Those who then would awaken
Found their universe shaken,
Dispossessed of its bedrock, belief.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
His digging in Egypt was backed
To seek treasure long hidden, intact.
Howard Carter sought gold—
Tutankhamun got rolled.
Eight more years it would take to extract.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Mine's the bench he'd a penchant to find
In the dim of his criminal mind.
Not a brain, he'd maintain
That my dog and my cane
Furnished proof that my justice was blind.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I live just up the frog. My abode
Is right there," I advised. My ride slowed,
Since he knows rhyming slang
Like the rest of the gang.
(Frog and toad becomes frog = "road.")

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cathy's conduct is getting me down.
She's developed a certain renown,
For the way she'll address me
Can't help but depress me.
I'm known as "her clown" around town.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The run-of-the-mill resurrectant
Is normally very amplectant:
At support he must clasp
With a tendrilly grasp,
And of falling back down is expectant.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
His behaviour seems odd, slightly hurting:
When we date, he is always deserting —
Every gig I have planned
(Every choir, every band),
He runs out — which I find disconcerting.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A church lady, proper and prim,
Was unusually moved by a hymn,
So she sang out the canticle
In a style so romantical
That the minister turned the lights dim.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Here I sit in the brig in a cell
For my status: AWL.
These MPs can't conceive
That it means I'm on leave.
I believe they should learn how to spell.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Chicot is our very next word.
It's a name in a title, I've heard,
Of a famed Dumas story.
Chicot hasn't glory—
He's the jester to Henry the Third.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
No excuse would they ever accept,
For the laws of Sharia weren't kept.
Through her sobbing and tears
She heard, "Prison, ten years!"
"Mercy, please!" But she futilely wept.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
When engaged in their far-reaching duels,
Politicians should follow the rules,
And never misstep on
Their choice of a weapon.
Atomic bombs suffer no fools.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You say you're too fearful to stand,
Or to walk without holding my hand?
And that these morbid fears
Have a name?  I'm all ears!
Basophobia—ain't English grand?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Her lover, a linguist, would criticize,
And each phrase, anglo-franco-politicize.
"I am sorry, my femme,
But you can't say 'Je t'aime'
Without t', so we always must cliticize."

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's a beautiful girl in the choir
Whose angelic voice sets me afire.
For her I am burning.
With love I am churning.
I'll explode if she sings any higher.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the case of Missouri v. Murray,
The judge had enjoined us, the jury,
To deliberate well,
But from what I could tell,
The defendant had nary a worry.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Read this bio of Einstein, contriving
To clarify; still I am striving
To fathom his quote
In that famed anecdote:
"When is Zurich to this train arriving?"

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
An old neighborhood diner chef, Joe,
Is renowned for his fine escargots.
Mismatched teacups and mugs
Hold these buttery slugs,
Topped with garlic and aged French Bordeaux.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Caught stealing to feed my addictions,
In court I'll devise clever fictions,
Which is easy for me:
I've the courage, you see,
Of my (numerous prior) convictions.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Kate announced, "I have written a play
That is zany, with gay repartee."
"With no skill dialogic,
Her work's hypnagogic,"
Wrote critics, in utter dismay.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
If it's true Alfred Agostinelli
Was Proust's lover, Marcel didn't tell. He
Played checkers, chauffeured —
But what further occurred?
Remembrance is lost in Time's belly.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm Christopher, true, but I ain't
Like that fella I'm named for—the saint.
I was sinless till twelve,
When I started to delve
Into matters that made my mom faint.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
When guys play at football for keeps,
They tackle and make flying leaps.
At the end of each down,
They are tumbled aroun'
All acervative (piled up in heaps).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I go through a night that is dreamless,
Though I find the experience themeless
(No fiend-laden dream
Makes me wake with a scream),
I get eight hours of sleep that is seamless.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
"I'm a biblical Beast of mean tricks
With a deadline that no one can nix.
I wish nobody well
As I rise up from Hell:
For some kicks, I'm en route (666)."

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Whether condoms you purchase for sex,
Or salsa for flavors Tex-Mex,
Goods that hucksters tout "Buy!
New! Improved! You must try!"
Are not the ones labeled Brand X.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
When downloading songs for a lark,
On a point of the law I'll remark:
The copyrights say
That to play, you must pay
(Else a fine, or to jail you'll embark).

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Today, dogs seem quite kind, we'd agree,
And yet "dog-hearted" (cruel as can be)
Wrote the Bard, one sharp dude.
Since Will's time, we conclude
That our dogs have progressed more than we.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Your double-faced bookshelf provides
Ample shelving for books on both sides,
But placed in the hall,
Flat against the hall wall,
Half the books you have stored there it hides.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A confectioner, Abdul Rajit,
Was killed in Kabul.  His afreet
Encased his attacker
In chocolatey lacquer:
Revenge, for this spirit, was sweet.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
"I trained hard, so I won! I'm ecstatic."
(One results in the other: ecbatic).
"From when I begin
I train so as to win."
(That is telic: intention emphatic).

limerick_list.author: Margaret Ford
limerick_list.text:
While others bemoan his confusion,
Our king is intoning delusion.
We can't disenthrone
That crazy old drone—
Unless we condone his 'conclusion'.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Listen, daughter, I seem to recall
"Dark and handsome," you wanted, and "tall."
Get good looks in your man
If you possibly can,
But be sure that he's true, above all.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
In the dry chaparral of the West,
These mauve-flowered mallows grow best.
Morning dew's moisture cleaves
To the fuzz on their leaves.
They resist fire and drought—I'm impressed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though my lawyers consider it sneaky
(I admit that the tactic is cheeky),
To wow judge and jury, I,
With amicus-type curiae,
Will submit more than fifty amici.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
When you're venturing boldly to read a
New Indian language, you need a
Fresh mindset — each sign
Lets its consonant twine
With a vowel.  That's called abugida.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
When a seizure afflicts him, he knows
That convulsions are not how it goes.
But his vague glassy stare
Means he's not really there.
Like as not, he'll black out; absence shows.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
The boss said of me, "He's deep-read,"
And those words drilled a hole in my head.
"What the hell? Are you barmy?
I'm no socialist commie!"
"No, I mean that you're learned," he said.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a chef, Betty Ann is a silly girl.
On top of each dish, she'll add Dilly Girl.
"Though this garlicky cheddar,"
I said, "makes meals better,
Don't use Dilly Girl so willy-nilly, girl!"

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Your fervent belief in the Rapture
Has, sadly for everyone, sapped your
Desire to care
About what's in the air:
All the carbon we now need to capture.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
It's a sad day our children will greet
When consumption is over, complete.
They will walk home, alas,
When they've run out of gas —
Which is surely a pain — in defeat.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
It's nothing to do with turbidity,
Nor solidity—no, nor rigidity.
Credit Mermin, whose works
Found the boojum, which lurks
Within helium superfluidity.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Let's pick up the pace just a smidgen!"
For my P.E. coach, speed was religion.
"Time to move your fat A!
Chop-chop!" he would say,
Which means "quick-quick" in English called Pidgin.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Was Butch Cassidy fierce and inhuman?
Some declare he was shy, unassumin',
And friendly, and yet
It's a pretty sure bet
He did not look at all like Paul Newman.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A decipherer's challenged to take
An unreadable code and to make
It a readable text,
But they sometimes are vexed
By a message they just cannot break.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Casaba's a melon—a fruit,
While cassava's a veggie—a root.
If I got them confused
I would not be amused;
I would lose my repute as astute.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
My lab's research is basic, it's pure—
There's no product in mind, that's for sure.
All our work's fundamental.
Useful stuff? Accidental.
Sadly, grants can be hard to procure.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Anosphresia's making me think:
Are you right when you claim that I stink?
If a man couldn't smell,
How the hell would he tell?
Hold your nose while I buy you a drink.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
To the French, an excess is  de trop.
As if that weren't enough, they may throw
'Ça suffit!' in your face
If you speak out of place.
'Nuffalready!' might be the bon mot.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That last dinner was money well spent,
And perhaps they're about to relent.
For Mom and Dad's blessing
At last, I'm progressing.
I'm desperate to cinch their consent.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Catalonia's a region in Spain
Where La Liga's new champions train.
Barcelona's the team;
Playing soccer's the dream.
At the Nou Camp these footballers reign.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
She had ailurophobia — that's
An intense fear or hatred of cats.
Her acidic aspersions
On both of my Persians
Caused most of our squabbles and spats.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Ferroequinologists? Never!" cried Lulu.
"To date one's a serious boo-boo.
When a man is with me,
I'm insulted should he
Prefer spending his time with a choo-choo!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
An alto is singing as low
As most women's voices will go.
But alto means high!
It is, for a guy.
And once, gal performer meant ho.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When you're dining at Gabe's dinner table,
I am sure, as you sup, you'll be able
To tell fiction from fact.
He will be inexact—
Brag it's made of pure gold. That's a fable.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Gert is jealous and spiteful, a flirt,
Who does terrible things that can hurt.
She tells lies: told our boss
I'd turned profit to loss;
She's an expert in doing folks dirt.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An allogamous plant is the one
That will find reproduction most fun.
Two sep'rate plants germinate,
Ova-and-sperminate,
Join, and then new life's begun.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Athlete's foot? Ringworm? You ought to know, Sis:
Antifungals cream dermatophytosis.
So until the MO sees
These dermatophytoses,
Treat my jock itch with generous doses.

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
One concept has left me aghast:
When two statements, both valid, contrast.
It is not mental bliss,
This antinomy, Miss,
To accept it as logic at last.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
I have cable, though not HBO,
So I missed Friday night's boxing show.
 But I called my friend Zeke,
 Who's a big boxing freak,
And he gave me the whole blow-by-blow.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
It is not that I don't like a gnat,
I naturally fly where they're at,
But a change to my diet?
I'd sure like to try it!
Just what is the problem with that?

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
I'd like to get Mike out of jail,
But try as I might, I would fail,
Since the hard-hearted judge
Holds a grudge and won't budge
And has ordered him held without bail.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Control-M isn't used much today.
Looking back, it was always this way.
It's the thirteenth, you see,
When you count A to Z,
So it may bring bad luck, you might say.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Buck private's the lowest of ranks.
When you're new, you're the victim of pranks.
With one stripe on my sleeve,
You may think me naive,
But report in buck naked?  No thanks!

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
My appetites, dear, are edacious,
Whether meat, drink or sex—I'm voracious.
And with vigour afresh,
I will gorge on all flesh
(It's a good thing my pants are capacious).

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
A grimoire can be grim as the Reaper,
Full of spells to cause evil. No cheaper,
But broader in reach
Are the spellbooks that teach
All sorts of enchantments (much deeper).

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Her belittlement grated his nerves,
So he threw down his tray of hors d'oeuvres
On the floor of her foyer.
He'd find an employer
Who'd pay the respect he deserves.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
I am breaking my rice bowl, that's it!
I believe my complaint is legit:
I am going berserk,
My new boss here at work
Is a jerk and a twit—Oh, I quit!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
She approached my piano, most pissed.
Playing chords, I ignored her.
                                                  "Desist!"
She insisted, and whacked
Down the fallboard. It cracked
Seven fingers and broke my right wrist.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
If barbecued meats flip your wig,
Then it's baby back ribs that you'll dig.
For good taste you can't beat 'em.
A rabbi won't eat 'em...
They come from the loin of a pig.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Not much point in your fieri facias,
For my claim to be rich was mendacias;
I've no assets to seize,
Nor funds you could freeze:
I've spent it on sushi and gacias.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
When I'm driving, it's (to my dismay)
Guaranteed I'll be going astray.
A brain disconnection
Denies me direction
That's needed for finding my way.

limerick_list.author: paulthompson
limerick_list.text:
"My Jane's on a boat.  She's aboard
A West Indian cruise," said Miss Ford.
"Jamaica?" I queried.
"Oh no," she said, wearied,
"She went of her own free accord."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With dry vomiting (AKA "retching"),
You make noises that aren't very fetching
Such as "haaack!" and "a-whooook!"
As you puke without puke
From some cause that I pray is not catching.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
A crucible's sort of a pot,
Although not one you'd bang as a tot.
It's a specialized kettle
(Ceramic or metal)
And used when things really get hot.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
He'd told her he wanted to sketch her.
"Why not come up and see (I'm an etcher)
My etchings," he'd said,
As he led her to bed.
"Now undress. Yes!" (The dirty old lecher.)

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
A victim of blackwater makes
Darkened urine, has fever, and aches.
The word also means waste-
water—viewed with distaste,
As are Blackwater's current mistakes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Caudate nuclei, deep in your head,
Are important for motion, it's said,
And for muscle tone too—
I'm not sure if that's true—
I just know that without them, you're dead.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
If your life's topsy-turvy, don't fret.
If it's higglety-pigglety, let
What's inside you get out,
And then turn things about—
Bid good-bye to confusion: no sweat!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Here's a cumulative frequency clue:
If A's frequency's equal to 2,
And B's equals 8,
Then these numbers summate:
You accumulate 10. Easy, true?

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
On eclipses, a science-fair triptych
Says this:  See, Earth's orbit's elliptic.
The sun's at one focus.
Its plane is their locus,
And so it is called the ecliptic.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
If you step out of line, they're the ones
Who will rap on your knuckles or buns.
They're a very feared force.
I am speaking, of course,
Of the disciplinarian nuns.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
At the fair, we've signed up to be dunkees
At the dunking booth game, 'cause those monkeys
Just can't hit the side
Of a barn—they're so fried!
(Guess it's true that their patrons are junkies.)

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
"Define digitipartite again."
"Something hemp-leaf in shape," I explain,
"Simply parted like fingers."
(The herbal smell lingers—
Good cannabis eases my pain.)

limerick_list.author: Katherine Hooper
limerick_list.text:
The eight ball is what you're behind
When you've gotten yourself in a bind —
When you hear your wife's sighs,
And you then realize
That her birthday, in fact, slipped your mind.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Geography teacher Miss Meyers
Distributed numerous flyers.
They showed the main alley
In "Waterworks Valley"
In Jersey (the water suppliers).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Kurtz's labor is fitful (in spurts).
We observe he's distracted by skirts.
With his stopping and starting,
He'll soon be departing.
His work's so erratic, it hurts.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'd say John's extemporaneousness stinks;
He's much worse off-the-cuff than he thinks.
But the guy gets much better
As things get much wetter —
The more that the night club crowd drinks.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
On my rose bush, a brace of convergents
Are fighting an aphid resurgence.
As these ladybugs feed,
They are just what I need
For American Beauty's emergence.

limerick_list.author: Chris Howlett
limerick_list.text:
There's a hill that I think's rather neat.
It rises to eight hundred feet,
Formed by glacial motion.
I haven't a notion
Why it came to be called Arthur's Seat.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Her demeanour is easily read.
She is vulgar and coarse, not well-bred,
Neither cultured nor douce,
As refined as a goose—
But I bet she's tiger in bed.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Have you noticed I'm looking forlorn?
Between present and future I'm torn.
Will I actualize lives?
When I'm playing with knives
I am haunted by throngs of Unborn.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
There are footmarks impressed in the snow,
And I wonder, where do these prints go?
I proceed, brave the weather
(Steps get closer together),
And find kids in their "cave", lying low.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Independence her deafening vow,
Felicia must scavenge for chow,
For she lives on the street,
With a babe on the teat.
That's her life as an alleycat. Meow.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
A craft is a trade needing skill
In a manual art, if you will,
Such as woodwork or beadwork.
It's surely agreed work
Like this is both handy and brill!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said a virgin, "I'd like to abstain
From premarital sex."  "Why refrain?"
Asked the guy she was dating.
They were later caught mating
At Bob's Quickie Chapel on Main.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
He's got perfect duende, I say,
And he charms at Jose's Cabaret.
His flamenco's enchanting:
Señoritas—they're panting.
They follow him home every day.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Worth prerogative, your personality?
Deserve privilege in your locality?
Wishful thinking! Indulge—
But I have to divulge,
What you ask is extreme: cure reality.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I don't like how you dress like a clown.
I don't like how you strut about town.
But, of course, I'll be there,
Even if people stare:
It's a given I won't let you down.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
In the hot Cold War race to the Moon,
The first landing no second too soon:
Far away three were shot;
Two then landed — one not.
Who today still recalls that third loon?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Sarge was wearing beribboned dress greens,
Clothes designed to impress, by all means.
It's a uniform worn
Never dirty or torn
Or when detailed with cleaning latrines.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My hubby's new hobby is x,
As in axial, xebec, and hex.
Since starting to dabble
In tournament Scrabble,
He's axially better at sex.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
My friends say I simply can't see
That she's bitchy as bitchy can be.
Guess her barbs are so sharp
I've been caught like a carp—
Now that Barb's got her hooks into me.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
In feudal times, rulers (kings, queens)
Who had vassals (like knights, bishops, deans)
Would enfeoff them with land
Or with property, and
Thus promote them to men of some means.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Those Chicago rat-tat-a-tat type-
writers didn't mince words, and a wipe-
out by Lucky or Bugs
Of so many more thugs
Gave grave meaning to settling a gripe.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
Name a cubitus valgus causation?
A genetically based malformation
(So your elbow, when dangled,
Turns outwardly angled)
Or a break in a nasty location.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
I was trying to sleep on the plane.
Got a crick in my neck (what a pain)—
Put my hip out of whack,
But the day I got back,
My fine bone cracker took out the strain.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
The beauties of whom we have read
In Byron and Shakespeare are dead,
But Calverley found
More dependable ground
When he glorified beer brands instead.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
On a factory farm way out west,
They're just doing the thing they do best:
Planting small metal beans
To grow into machines
That will make any thing you request.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Mismatched socks I must constantly wear;
They get lost in my dryer's hot air.
From each pair of my hose
It takes one — how, who knows?
It dispairs them, until I despair.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Says the government, "We'll decommission
Your nuclear plant—no more fission."
They'll remove it from service.
The thought makes me nervous;
I'll join the pro-nuke coalition!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the old days, for war you'd equip
A large dromon—a swift fighting ship.
Using sails (also oars),
It defended your shores
And sank enemy boats at a clip.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Now, chiropody handles your feet —
Treating corns, warts and bunions: its beat.
Chiropractic's assignment
Is your spine's realignment.
While chirography: handwriting, neat.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Alpine cheese spread all over your bod —
Mellow yellow, Italian, by God!
I have never been keena
To slurp up fontina
And feast on your luscious façade.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Boston Brahmins are families  still
Living on or around Beacon Hill.
They're American peerage
Who didn't come steerage,
Can send, down the nose, looks that kill,

Don't use cash, but say,  "Send me a bill,"
Eat their pasta with lemon and dill,
Own a cattle ranch down in Brazil,
Put a Hahvahd bequest in their will;
Think  their own genealogies thrill—
Someone help me stop writing this swill!

limerick_list.author: Suzanne Kreul
limerick_list.text:
When the autotroph came on the run,
He cried out, "What's for lunch, honey bun?"
So his wife said, "My dear,
Same as always, I fear:
CO2, H2O, and the sun."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In England one can't say precocious
Of our press, but they're often ferocious,
Like this twisting linguistic:
"Super Caley go ballistic",
(Plus) "Celtic are" (really) "atrocious"!

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
Never play with a knife on a bender;
You could lose something precious and tender.
I was slashing while drunk
When I sliced off a chunk,
Inadvertently switching my gender.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A belle had to make a selection:
Evade or attract the detection
Of moles on her face.
A delight or disgrace?
Beauty patches enhanced imperfection.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Lexicographers here had concurred:
"The entry we need for this word
Isn't birding. Instead,"
A wise editor said,
"The infinitive's simply to bird."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cytologic, this smear over here
Shows a red cell that looks like a sphere,
And the white cells look queer.
It's a new disease, dear;
I'll describe it and boost my career.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
I need breathing space — back off a bit.
If you don't, there's a chance you'll get hit.
Let me do my own stuff,
'Cause you've more than enough
Of your own space; in mine, you don't fit.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A centre pawn starts from file e,
I can also begin from file d.
As you'll easily guess,
This is all about chess,
Where there's four  centre pawns you can see.

limerick_list.author: jesserifkin
limerick_list.text:
Las Vegas is closed, no one's here.
New Orleans is empty, I fear.
Cancun is near gone.
Where can folks party on?
Well, Hartford's nice this time of year.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dr. Casey? The interns all say she's
Not glamorous.  Far and away, she's
Got the homeliest face.
When describing a case
In her class, they don't look at her facies.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
This is death and destruction with class?
Fire one shell, drop one bomb, please the brass.
From one cluster bomb fell
Many bomblets — what hell
Where they land ... mourn with fake gravitas.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Well, Vulcan, my dear, just between us,
Titan arum bouquets won't sway Venus.
I note, without malice,
It's Amorphophallus
Titanum—a huge ugly penis.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
We diversified quickly, and yet
Our beginnings we'll never forget.
We made privies at first;
Now we're wholly immersed
In our new product: eau de toilette.

limerick_list.author: David and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Only those with a broad Scottish brogue
Can confirm that the cog's not in vogue.
For some long-ago folk,
Such a vessel of oak
Was a pail or a cup (same as cogue).

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Now 'fortune will favour the fool'
Is a saying I learned back in school.
That luck should be kind
To a man of weak mind
Seems  an odd, but considerate, rule.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
Fantasticality! Circus freaks here!
So drum up your courage, my dear,
And for one single dime,
See the creatures of slime
And the monster of shivering fear!

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
Two old Vikings named Rekdal and Riddal
Would meet on the poop deck to fiddle;
Thus they gaily explored,
Beating up the fjord,
Despite wind and a strong urge to piddle.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
Savvy spin doctors make a tale tall.
Any loss is no trouble at all:
"It's an incomplete win!"
That's the art of the spin!
Breezy bafflegab cushions a fall.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Thank the Lord we're arriving home soon;
I'm increasingly bad to hunt coon.
I thought, "Cruisin' at sea—
Heck, how rough could it be?"
But for coon hunts it ain't opportune.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though it now has a rep as a spot
More than civilized, Boston was not
So admired by the Brits
Under George III: "It's
Where your eye may be gouged by some sot."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I asked a physician named Dabney
If he'd shed some more light on my scabbed knee,
But he warned "If I do,
You will both look more blue,
Thanks to William de Wiveleslie Abney."

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
The amphibrach's driving this meter.
It certainly isn't eliter
Than iamb or trochee.
(Hey, check out this bloke! He
Has limericked the thing! What a cheater!)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said my dad, with the help of a graph,
"What you earn in this 'job' won't be half
Of a real job.  The thrills
Of a club won't pay bills.
A comedian?  Don't make me laugh."

limerick_list.author: Blind Pig
limerick_list.text:
Are you people who like this insane?
It's a cabbage that looks like a brain!
While it lies in my power,
I'll shun cauliflower
With distrust, plus disgust and disdain!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I say, Cambridge freshers—let's hop
On our bikes and head off to the bop!
Who can bear to revise
When the glittering prize
Of a disco tempts punters to stop?

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Ow! My forehead is bleeding, you twit!"
Don't be fit to be tied, in a snit.
Take a dressing (three angle)
Then fold but don't tangle:
A cravat bandage tied to be fit!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The odd mouse without limbs gets my pity,
Even troubles my somnolent kitty.
Ectromelia's the cause
Of the loss of its paws.
An odd virus, its impact's not pretty.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I gave her a cursory look
While forgetting you can't judge a book
By its cover.  I yearned
For a soul mate and learned
I'd been lured by her sub-surface hook.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Our Labrador's gone out to play
On the streets of our city today.
She'll be out on the run,
Having four-legged fun,
Till our dad takes her T-bone away.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I love sex, but for her it's a chore.
As for kids, she wants one; I want more.
She's agnostic; I pray.
I love jazz. Her? No way!
It's a pity we're not en rapport.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Sports are business today: teams are brimming
With profits the owners are skimming.
What next? I'd advise
That we corporatize
The pursuit we call synchronized swimming.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
In the morning, it never surprises
The doctor when blood glucose rises.
"It's far from uncommon" (yawn) —
"Called 'dawn phenomenon.'
"Insulin up," he advises.

limerick_list.author: stella
Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
If you like to eat eggs almost raw,
Then coddle them for little more
Than the time that it takes
To say "Chocolate cakes".
That is: dunk in hot water — withdraw!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Broken legs keep me glued to my chair;
I do nothing but sit still and stare.
My crippleness, lameness,
Enforces a sameness,
The toll for my lurid affair.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
You're a vagabond, aimlessly rootless,
And your effort's consistently fruitless.
Still, you never say die,
As you bootlessly try
What is pointless and stupidly bootless.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Our relationship's worse for the wear—
As we know it's beyond all repair.
It was great, it was fun.
As of now, it's undone.
So, so long. Neither you nor I care.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
It's his magical deftness of touch
That enthrals and excites her so much,
As his consummate skill
Transmits thrill after thrill.
I should curtain the grille of their hutch!

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
All summer, young Kate would berate
Her own self: "It's these freckles I hate!
I'm so light complected
I just feel rejected.
With this face, who'd want me for a date?"

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My Irvine's  a tenor (and louse).
He does drugs and he drinks — what a souse,
But we weep and get chills
When his "Danny Boy" trills.
Ah, there's not a dry eye in the house.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Catharistic, devout Albigenses
Were purged like the poor Albanenses.
Their heretical path
Drew the Vatican's wrath:
They got flushed, in the manner of menses.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A collision I'd hoped to avoid,
But my wife, that damn airbag, annoyed
With her chatter nonstop.
With a vein 'bout to pop,
I then crashed, and the airbags deployed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
An egestuous gent is young Cuddy,
Ever desperate for funds from a buddy,
Who, though loath to indict,
Still might gently invite
Him to toil. Is he likely? Not bloody.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
The life of Gesualdo: dramatic!
Like his colourful music, erratic.
Accidentals abound;
His unusual sound
Is amazingly, wildly chromatic.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
A Bush twin (not Barb, but the other)
Is shopping a kid's book. Oh, brother!
Can Jenna Bush write?
Do her verbal skills bite?
Let us hope she takes after her mother.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Our music displays fits and starts
'Cause we've scribbled all over the parts.
On your way in the door,
Pick up a clean score;
At last we've procured some new charts."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The caiman is kin to the gator,
Although size-wise the gator is greater.
Way down south, it's a fact,
There was one with an act
Of which I, proud to say, was creator.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
"Just look at the size of his butt!"
I heard as I sealed the cask shut.
I was taken aback
And affronted! The crack
Was about the big cask, that's what's what.
