limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Once a baby-maker, maker of dollies,
Jack went broke; it was one of his follies.
But that skill turned out handy:
He married Chef Brandi —
They beget baby candy (doll lollies).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Physics groupies are all the time talking
Of seducing that stud Stephen Hawking.
Their constant discussions
Promote repercussions:
They're often arrested for stalking.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The culicines (students, take heed)
Spread human disease when they feed.
Her proboscis injected?
You might be infected!
Malignant mosquitoes indeed.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Said a phagocyte cell, "I will eat
Other cells in this body I meet
If they're dead or debris—
It's cytophagy, see—
And no pathogen's safe on my beat."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The assistant professor complained,
"I wish my adviser'd explained
That you strive to get tenure,
But afterwards, then you're
Predestined to tarry here, chained."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"My support for this bill I profess."
Is he voting his conscience?  I guess,
But the timing seems strange
For his compass to change —
What was wrong now is right; he'll vote yes.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Find a doorknocker fixed to a door,
Perhaps four or five feet from the floor.
Now, by hand you may flap
The device. Hear the rap.
Then repeat polite thumps as before!

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
If possession is nine-tenths the law,
I believe there's a ten percent flaw.
I am not giving up
On retrieving my pup—
I'll get custody, nose tip to paw.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Your honor, this claim is obscene
For some bicycle crunched in between
My new Benz and a truck.
It was simply bad luck,
And the plaintiff is only thirteen!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Angiography's when you're subjected
To having your bloodstream inspected
By x-ray.  This test
Has been shown to work best
After radiopaque goo is injected.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
They say Dowland, composer, was taught
By a pro, and in Denmark the court
Took his lute to their heart,
But in England this start
Didn't make for the status he sought.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
Our mobility scooters now cost less:
We've a stockpile of fuel cells, exhaustless.
We're known as the Waltz Timers,
Bros rolling with Alzheimer's—
By riding together we're lost less.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
An astronomer, one William Herschel,
Once published a comet commercial.
That his comet had "hair",
A chevelure, very fair,
Was exciting, though noncontroversial.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
She felt drops from on high; it was drippy,
So she carefully walked down the slippy,
Steep, treacherous street,
Caring not whom she'd meet:
That promiscuous woman — a chippy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I fear my statistics are skewed,
As the birth rate Lew gave me was crude.
Is it, then, not correct?
I would like to object
But I'd hate to appear to be rude!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A career in chiropody? Sweet!
I will join the physicians' elite!
(Till the strain of podiatry
Leads to psychiatry,
Haunted by horrible feet.)

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I snuffle, I sneeze, and I snort.
I drip, and I wheeze.  I contort.
Do you need a reason?
It's allergy season!
And that is my nasal report.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said a sickly young guy from Siberia,
Who developed a case of diphtheria,
"I will never get well
Here—it's colder than hell!"
So he travelled to sunny Algeria.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Store front windows: I've made them my trade.
Dressin' dummies is how I get paid.
One strange day, this here mannequin
Said, "Hey!" I went panickin',
An' a hole through the window I made.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I've a need to be worshipped seraphically;
It would hurt if you chose to live sapphically.
Prove your ardency's real:
Let me test you for zeal
Electroencephalographically.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A seductress enticed a dictator,
"There's more for dessert, honey... later."
She was hardly to know
When he struck her a blow
And afterwards sat down and ate her.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Built by Romans (first digging a trench),
It is Aix-la-Chapelle for the French.
Charlemagne—Charles the Great,
In historical weight,
Sat in Aachen, as king on his bench.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Here's a flake that's been struck from a core.
Can I learn a lot more from flint lore?
Was the flintknapper Russian?
The bulb of percussion
Says "hard hammer-strike," nothing more.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
'Tween the city and state courts, there sit
Those for counties, where judges acquit
Or convict an accused,
And are rarely amused
By the lawyers who pick every nit.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
This puzzle has only twelve pieces:
Age-appropriate, say, for your nieces.
It says Age three to five
On the label, but I've
Found, at ninety, the pleasure increases.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
When you're captain you choose from the pack
The best players (the ones with the knack).
As the pickings grow slim,
You confess it looks grim—
After gym class you're gonna catch flak.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
An aide took her duties too far,
Which prompted much digging by Starr.
Smokin' assets so reachable
Led to lies so impeachable—
This young intern deserves a cigar!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"This vaccine is created quadrivalently—
Four virus types used, unambivalently.
It's as good as what you
Have been using for flu!"
"Sure they're both good," replied Tom equivalently.

limerick_list.author: Mary and stella
limerick_list.text:
Recounted in story and song,
Are Gallipoli's tales that belong
To the ANZACs who fought
And, in dying there, brought
To their nations a pride that's still strong.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
Our lovely young foreign au pair
Tends our kids with her competent care;
  But when they go out
  With their mother, I shout
"May we now please begin our affair?"

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Under wraps you've reneged from the start.
Laughed when dropping folks right in the cart.
But I'll soon stop your laugh:
Spill the beans—blow the gaff.
Yes, go public and tear you apart.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
For camera movement, see Dan:
He knows just when to track or to pan,
When to pedestal, dolly,
Truck, zoom, tilt... By golly,
For teaching or work, Dan's the man.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Wise King Solomon's name's held aloft
Though the height of his rep has been scoffed,
When discussing the lives
Of his hundreds of wives,
Claiming most must have had it quite soft.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
The fruit of the plant creeping snowberry's
Very soapy, so strive to forgo berries.
Symphoricarpos (that's mollis)
Is a Speedy Gonzales
When a fire drives a need to regrow berries.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Of the wine in the goblet, said He,
"This, My blood, shall be given for thee."
At each Mass, light my eye;
Raise the chalice on high,
With: "Do this in remembrance of Me."

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
I have just been invited — no, told —
To define the two words shown in bold,
But the clock time is four
And I don't wish to bore
As inane explanations unfold.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Ignore at your peril, this lyric:
Mort said no to vaccines.  Triumph pyrrhic,
Since sadly old Mort
And his daughters all caught
Dread diphtheria. Now they're diphtheric.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
This herb isn't run-of-the-mill
(Like eponymous pickles). Stand still.
If you'll get your hands warshed,
I'll make you some borscht,
Or some salmon, with sprinklings of dill.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That same rod that supports a guy's tent,
When employed with her tacit consent,
In an odd sort of sowing,
May start a life growing.
That's a gamogenetic event.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dick the Damster builds dams (hence the name)
For the logging profession. His claim:
"Clearly, this dam achiever
Outdams any beaver—
I have since the first day I came."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In response to community frictions,
Our covenants, conditions and restrictions.
All agreed to and signed
(Though at first much maligned),
Have endured despite gloomy predictions.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Thinking earnings means 'all that I earn',
I work harder and harder, then learn
It means 'how much I'm paid',
Which ain't much; I'm dismayed,
As my bosses have money to burn.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With the enemy's full capitulation
Came the following clarification:
The Army's commander
Refuted the slander
That he coveted canonization.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's ghost-plagued and far from baronial:
A two-hundred-year-old colonial
With papers to prove it.
You're forbidden to move it.
Any change would need God's testimonial.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There are words where we make an elision,
Though not via conscious decision.
A vowel's omission,
By use and attrition,
Accounts for this common revision.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
A cocky young bucko from Cork
Called to curly colleen Kate O'Rourke:
"You're mine at the ceilidh!"
She answered him, gaily:
"Not likely, you arrogant dork!"

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
When the blackout struck, no one could bake
A blackout cake, nor grill a steak.
In those hours unpowered,
Our old love life flowered;
In nine months, we welcomed son Jake.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This brittlebush, growing beneath
Desert skies, has a lot to bequeath.
It is used to make glue,
And as chewing gum too,
And by cowboys for brushing their teeth.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
South Sudan has become a new nation.
This poor country achieved separation
From its neighbor up north
And, now free, issues forth,
While its people enjoy Juba-lation.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The chipmunk lives life at a dash.
Does this squirrel-like guy ever bash
Out his brains in the trees,
Or bump forelegs, or knees?
Lightning mover, he's gone in a flash.

limerick_list.author: Kakuzan
limerick_list.text:
Aunt Agatha hasn't a peer
At ruling the Woosters by fear.
She once got so shirty
At feckless young Bertie,
He stayed out of England a year.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Off to walk round the world? What a do!
And have everyone asking, "You're who?"
That's no trivial task
For a man in a mask;
Harry Bensley, we celebrate you.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
You delay and prevent any action.
You're tardy (a point of distraction);
You are dilatory, sir!
I think Freud will concur:
From this trait you derive satisfaction.

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
Elliptical speech is obscure.
It starts, but then takes a detour.
You can't pin it down.
Should you laugh?  Should you frown?
Is that truth in your ears, or manure?

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
I have apnea; breathing's a chore.
Till my airway collapses, I snore.
Then all noises will cease
Till my brain sends release
With a gasp, and I'm breathing once more!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
U. S. Grant said "Tarnation!"  affectedly,
As he sat in his saddle dejectedly.
"They surrendered; that's good.
But then not as they should —
Who rode up? Sergeant Schwartz! We expected Lee."

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
An IP is a numbered address,
But to memorize? Oh, what a mess.
So we give it a nom
That might end in .com,
And for lookups we use DNS.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Our young Bob sadly lacked common sense,
With a long list of blunders immense.
His old dad used to say,
In a fatherly way,
"Oh you claht 'ead, you really are dense!"

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Besting bull-butchers, Blossom believes,
Begins best before blade breath bereaves.
Because butcheries ban
Breathing beef, Bloss began
Buying bulls before bulls became beeves.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
He was reared in a seamy bordello;
His skin's a diseased shade of yellow.
Rather worn and unclean
For a lad of eighteen,
He's in less than fine fettle, this fellow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As a rule, I like finding the bright side
Of life; I maintain it's the right side.
I prefer the moon's dayside
To its facing-away side,
And I take no delight in its nightside.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Drunken drivers, I'm warning you now!
Hurt my grandsons and this I avow:
I will never forgive you.
In fact, I'll dislive you
As quickly as fate will allow.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Sea-anemones lodge on his back
For the hermit crab's scared of attack.
This creature aquatic
Has allosematic
Protection — he's no tasty snack!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The dollar's a currency unit.
Ascetics and hermits impugn it,
But others embrace it.
We love it, let's face it.
Let roses and daisies festoon it!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Fundamentalist, him! He'll believe
All that stuff about Adam and Eve,
Snake and apple — each smidgen:
"God's law's my religion,
Each literal word." How naive!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Wow, you've made this an Edenized place —
It's your very own paradise, Grace!
And what's totally cool
Is your nakedness rule:
Not a suit in the pool.  Let's embrace!

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
When Abert watched sparrows, although he
Denied it, we'd reason to know he
Was hoping for fame:
A new bird he could name.
And he found one: d'you know Abert's towhee?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An auxiliary bishop is free
To assist with affairs of the see,
But he cannot succeed
(Even when there's a need)
And be boss, say the powers-that-be.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I'm a serious radiosport player
And the E region answers my prayer,
For it fades with the day
As its ions decay
In the Kennelly-Heaviside layer.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Just last week I affected a brogue
As a joke. Seems that isn't in vogue
In my upper-crust school.
Why? Because of this rule:
"No Scotch accents in class!" I'd gone rogue.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
In commercial affairs you will find
Many document needs you must mind.
Most are forms and official
(Some look prejudicial);
Just watch for a paperwork bind.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
"Time to set off the bomb! I presume
That you've lit its long fuse? Then we'll zoom
Safely out of harm's way—
Wait, what's that that you say?
It was only six inches? Shi–" BOOM!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A computer-based outfit in Nome
Had lost contact with clients in Rome.
On a memo was scrawled:
"There's a backhoe day called."
All the techie types got to go home.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Different fruit on one tree's what I'm after:
I graft trees; you could call me a grafter.
Yes, it works, but my chum
Grafted apple to plum.
Well, you couldn't get very much dafter.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My sex  life was slow — quite  a bore.
With my bloke in the sack, couldn't score.
Took a virtual chance
With a cyber-romance.
Soon his cyber-wife knocked at my door!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In grand opera the lines are all sung.
It's a style not much loved by the young.
If you have a strong voice,
You might make this your choice.
Sing your guts out, but don't bust a lung.

limerick_list.author: Screenhog
limerick_list.text:
The sky's gradient started out blue,
Shifting yellow, then orange in hue,
Superbly displaying,
As though God were saying,
"Hey guys, I know Photoshop too!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
It was hydrodynamic and fast;
O'er the sun's outer surface it passed.
But this wave was unknown
(Though effects could be shown)
'Til by Alfvén at last it was classed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our DA has habitually built
A strong case to make jurymen tilt
Toward his side and feel onerated,
The accused is exonerated
At times—he is found free of guilt.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
I am entitative. Yes, I exist.
My reality can't be dismissed.
I'm an actual bloke,
Not just mirrors and smoke.
You don't think so?  Well, here — that's my fist.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I'm sitting day in and day out
Writing limericks; my passion's devout.
Asked my mama, "Good Lord!
Don't you ever get bored?
With no respite, your butt's gonna sprout."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The white-crowned American wigeon
Has a short narrow bill (like a pigeon).
It breeds in the north,
Has its hatchlings, goes forth
To find forage, then feeds them a smidgen.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The complete works of Melville? Oh, boy—
Now there's a thought fills me with joy.
The heart of his corpus?
An overgrown porpoise,
And multiple wails of "Ahoy!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My job at the school was aborted,
It was long, but it's longness was shorted.
Teeching english is not
That at whitch I'm too hot
So from class I was forthright escorted.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The sassy Belinda Berlin
Was a brassy identical twin,
And her sister, named Nora,
Was brazen—she wore a
Brassière made of copper and tin.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Her stained dress had the most evidentiary
Weight in that "Crime of the Century".
Since Exhibit A-3
Bore his DNA, he
Got life in a state penitentiary.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Hey, sweet thang, I jus' moved inta town.
Where's the action, like, what's goin' 'roun'?
What's the groove? Where's a cat
Gotta go? Where's it at?
Hey, what's hap'nin', Babe? What's goin' down?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My oration about rutherfordium
Began like a tiny primordium—
An organ's first germ.
This I plan to affirm
In my preface (the  lecture's exordium).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
It doesn't take lots of acuity
To notice a dis- 
continuity 
In my gimmerick's flow.
That's a trick that I know
To define it without ambiguity.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Cannabusinesses' commerce in weed
Gives the stoners the product they need.
The consumers who toke
Are so eager to smoke
That we're seeing a tie-dyed stampede.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
A mirage that we witnessed today
Is a namesake of Morgan le Fay.
Taller images, blurred,
Some inverted, recurred
In a fata morgana display.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"I am bupkis!" I quaver, aquiver,
So ignored I shall cry me a river.
Though my siblings get lots,
I'm left out, and I plotz.
"Oy vey! What am I, then? Chopped liver?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a word that shouts: "This crime is worse!"
For example, some thug steals a purse.
Does he grab it and run?
No, this punk has a gun
To intimidate, threaten, coerce.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I just called on  my beau.  He was bedding
My bridesmaid! I'm shocked! I am heading
Right home to send email
To him and this female—
You traitors! I've called off the wedding!

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
A girlie mag's view, if you heed 'em:
For ladies, no clothes equals freedom!
Be proud of your bod!
And yet here's something odd:
I don't think it's the girlies who read 'em.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
On a whim—that's to say, on a crotchet—
I decided to stay, and to watch it,
When some crotchety cook
Would crochet with a hook,
Getting grouchy whenever she'd botch it.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Episcopicide: it means killing
A bishop. Not many are willing
To bump off a guy
Who in churchdom's so high,
And the concept itself appears chilling.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
If you call it a dit it's a dot (·),
A fact which must not be forgot.
And  a dash (–) equals dah —
Have you got it so far?
It's  Morse code and I used it a lot.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
Ah, this life is much sweeter than taffy;
Yes, my soul is at peace. I am happhy,
For I'm stringing a string
Of bright anapest-bling
All while practicing lexicography.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
PGS
limerick_list.text:
. . And the liquid climbs upward in wicks
: To form vapor that's going to mix
: With the air in the flame —
: Light and heat from the same
: Melt the solid — and now the flame licks —
: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . :

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
One sausage that's German, served hot,
Is a bratwurst.  The short form is brat.
But I must warn you that
If you're some kind of brat,
Will I grill you a brat?  I think not!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Mr. Thistle, what's this all about?
All our rules you dismiss — baldly flout.
I have read your epistle;
It made my hairs bristle.
I'm blowing the whistle — you're out!
limerick_list.question: Does Mr. Thistle follow our rules?

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
If you go to a wedding, think twice
Before throwing great handfuls of rice.
Would you throw dry spaghetti?
Well, no! But, confetti —
Small shaped flakes of paper — is nice.

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
You are young.  You are brave. So there's hope.
And being in love, you elope,
Running off to get married.
Do you wish you had tarried?
You missed a big wedding.  You dope!

limerick_list.author: dasharath
limerick_list.text:
An herb that creates quite a mess,
The pungently named bitter cress,
With a pop will dehisce,
Flinging seeds hit-or-miss—
As ye sow, so ye reap, more or less.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
She was happy her boy really dug her,
But annoyed that whenever he'd hug her,
He'd become, said the lass,
A real pain in the ass,
Since he'd recently started to bug her.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"You tripped on some razor-sharp wire,
Then landed head-first in a fire.
Your calmness is baseless:
You're footless and faceless!"
"But groin-height—that would have been dire."

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
